text: THE DRYEST BURGER IVE EVER EATEN.... $40 for 2 burgers and fries and I would rather eat a McDonald's double cheeseburger.

First off the staff was really nice. They came to the table quickly to take my order and get my drink. They kept checking up and kept my drink topped off. They had the check ready to go at the end. 

As for the food. I started off with the Chicken Wings with the Honey Chipotle sauce. The wings tasted great. They had a nice breading and the sauce had a nice sweet and spicy kick to it. I would recommend these to anyone. 

I also got the The Cowboy. It comes with Applewood smoked bacon, barbecue sauce, crisp onions and Pepper Jack cheese. I got the burger Medium which it was more well done. The Applewood bacon was on point and the star of  this burger. Had a great taste and was really thick bacon. However, even with medium the burger seemed dry and lacked in taste. I found myself always grabbing for my drink after a bit and didnt have any juices running out the back of the burger. The barbecue sauce also almost seemed missing. I could see it but could not taste it. Overall the burger was just alright but I would not get it again. 

I also got the Garlic fries which are the normal hand-cut fries with some garlic butter and olive oil added. If you like garlic they are pretty good. As long as you have no plans later or dont mind garlic breathe for a few hours I would recommend them. 

Overall in the end it is a burger joint and I felt the burger was lacking in flavor and juiciness. Might have just been a bad night so I would try a different burger at a later time.

The southwest burger is awesome with its jalapeño bacon, wow!!! My gf ordered the chicken bltg.  The chicken breast was huge, juicy, and flavorful, just how I like'em. We also shared a side if onion rings.  They were crispy and not dripping oil. And they were very generous with their bacon servings

Went to BBB after the hockey game. Got right in. Hostess was professional, seating was great. Service was fast and pleasant. Food was very good. Burger cooked exactly how I asked for it. BUT, it's Christmas Time. Could've spent more than $10 at the Dollar Store to make it more festive. Would highly recommend the food and service. The ambiance was cheap and reflective upon the management to make it as cheap as possible.

I like that they use hormone free beef meat! Yeah! My husband tried the burger and I tried the caesar salad with beef patty. Both items are satisfactory and good. The price is not bad, and they offer 10% off to Nevada residents too. we found out this deal on the website. Would be nice if they would note this deal somewhere in the restaurant too. Anyway, the beef meat was good and size was good too. and the price is good with discount. We would consider coming back.
No 4 stars yet because of lack of services. People aren't rude, just lacking attentiveness.

My buddy and I ate here (for the second time) in June 2016. We both had a burger, fries and soft drink for ~$25 all in. Food was tasty, service was fast and friendly, and the street-like atmosphere is pretty cool.

https://www.tripadvisor.ca/ShowUserReviews-g45963-d2000144-r387461799-Broadway_Burger_Bar_and_Grill-Las_Vegas_Nevada.html#

Honestly one of the worst burgers I have ever eaten. I ordered a medium cooked cowboy burger and it was more like well done and very dry. My wife ordered a well done bacon cheese burger and I am not sure how she got through half of the burger. The service was good and the pineapple upside cake drink my wife had was outstanding which is why it got 2 stars instead of 1. 

Update: Since my bad experience at Broadway Burger, I was been contacted by their staff and after some great discussions they gave me a full refund my meal. They definitely have an A+ when it comes to customer service. I will definitely give Broadway Burgers after chance next time I am in Vegas. 

Update 2: My wife and I decided to give this place another chance and I am so glad we did. Completely night and day compared to the last time I was here. Of course my wife ordered the pineapple upside down cake drink. It is her favorite. Our food was really good. Burgers were cooked perfectly. Truly was a great experience. Thank you!
The worst food I had in Vegas. I would never come here. Avoid. Terrible burger and awful fries.

Standard burger. The garlic fries were good and I was impressed that they actually mixed in the garlic and just didn't plop a pile straight on top. We came for an early lunch (just got off the plane) so the service was pretty quick. Decent through and through.

We went to the Burger Bar last night. looking for  happy hour menu.  Their happy hour menu was very small but very good.  Our waitress was very good and  very sweet. We enjoyed our dinner and our service.  Would return.
Great burgers, Great prices, Great service. The burgers are so tasty. Sweet potato fries are waffled and crisp. Onion rings are a hit too. Must eat for anyone in your group or family

The Broadway Burger Bar & Grill is an outstanding addition to New York New York. I had the Southwestern Burger my first night at the hotel and I loved it so much I came back a couple of times. The burger was cooked to perfection, medium-well but incredibly juicy and flavorful. Topped with cotija cheese, jalapeno bacon and tortilla strips, it is now officially the burger of my dreams. The garlic fries are outstanding. They have a lot of unique burgers on the menu but you can also just get a plain-Jane cheeseburger if you want. Service was good on all my visits. I cannot wait to return to Las Vegas just so I can have another one of these burgers.

So my buddy's wife accidentally knocked over 2 beers. The girl working the bar, Dawn, would not replace them. It was a complete accident. It's understandable that she did not believe me, however Vegas bars give away free drinks all night long. To bit replace our beers after an honest mistake is absolutely ridiculous. Dawn should have incorporated her manager to find the root of the situation and provide good customer service by offering to romance the beers. She did not ask any questions. She just said I could purchase more beers as a solution. No thanks. On to Monte Carlo.

The service here was spectacular and the environment was so much fun with a group. We sat at the bar and the french fries were some of the best I have ever had. They also have a crazy extensive list of condiments!!

By far one of the best burgers I've ever had.  I love the fact they are healthy and non-greasy but so tasty!  We had the Southwestern and Philly Cheese Steak.  Definitely going back on our next trip to LV.

We had the turkey burger southwest style. Food was good but the presentation weird. They served the burger on a different plate than the bun. Our server was nice and had great recommendations for additions.

Exceptional burger and fries. I had back-to-back trips between June and July and was glad to discover this little gem. Great selection of burgers. Very high-quality beef and ingredients. One of the more interesting things is the available condiments and sauces to choose from. Ask for Dawn the bartender to help you select.
Excelente ambiente! Comida maravilhosa! Estávamos com muita fome por isto pedi agilidade o que fui prontamente atendido!

Had to stop in here at 4am because America was closed for cleaning (is that a metaphor? an allegory? HELP WHAT'S THE WORD I'M LOOKING FOR!?). I ordered a ham and cheese omelet with a side of fries. I wish I could post a photo to this review (and, who knows, maybe on the mobile app I can) but it was the most wan-looking, unappetizing omelet I've consumed in a very long time. The side of hash browns was bigger than said omelet, and not very exciting. I asked for hot sauce and the server brought me about 7 varieties of Tobasco. That was why this place gets 2 stars instead of 1.

Service was fine. I think my guy's name was James? He was working there instead of America because I guess the whole staff moved during the cleaning and was operating out of the Burger Bar's kitchen...but only serving the Burger Bar's menu? Yeah, I was just as confused as you were, and I was about 12 Jack-and-Cokes deep at that point. Honestly, I just wanted the gravy fries from America but I had to settle for this instead. Also when I received my place setting there was no fork. I was simply given a knife wrapped up inside a napkin. It was almost as if someone was trying to tell me, "It's 4am and you're wasted, eating an omelet and fries by yourself in a corner booth at a 24-hour diner. Kill yourself."

Obviously I didn't, because I'm here writing this review...

...From beyond the grave!!! OOoooooOOooOoooOOOhhhh...

A group of four of us stopped here as we just saw it while walking through New York New York. What a hit! The Bloody Mary mix is excellent and I had the Ahi Tuna Salad with the best wasabi dressing I e ever tasted in my life. My fiancé loved his burger and the other couple we were with loved their Philly with sweet potato waffle fries. I can't wait to go back! The service was great and the prices were reasonable too!
Chicken burger patties were cheap and expensive for the quality. I do not recommend this place.

I just had a cheeseburger and fries here but I thought it was definitely 4 stars. My burger had lots of flavor and the fries were awesome. The only complaint that I have is that the bun was a little dry. A nice fresh bun would have elevated this to 5 stars...maybe next time. The service was adequate. Our waitress was a bit shy at first but she opened up a little by the end of our meal. If you are looking for a good old fashioned big hamburger and fries...I would recommend going here.

Sweet burger bar. Was in the area and decided to try this place out. It was a pretty good experience and meal. The service was pretty quick and the atmosphere was fun. The burger I ordered was pretty good. Lots of great flavor and wasn't too expensive which is good. I had a great time and I look forward to coming back in the future.

Auf der Suche nach einem guten Burger am Strip bin ich im New York New York gelandet. Eigentlich passend zum Thema, sollte man denken.
Die Pommes waren stark verbrannt, beinahe schwarz (auch an den Nachbartischen). Der Burger schmeckte sehr fad, das Fleisch nicht wirklich frisch. Die 2 Sterne gibt's für die schöne Atmosphäre und die freundliche Bedienung.
If you are a Burger Fan you have to stop in and try this place. Its a little pricy so squeeze out the cash. But in any case, you wont go away feeling like you didn't get your money's worth.

My husband and I stayed at NYNY, which was our first time to stay there in Vegas.  We checked yelp and saw this place, so we decided to check out.  I don't eat beef, so I ordered vegitarian burger.  Oh boy, it was way salty and worst burger ever. My husband ordered Black and Blue burger.  He said meat was overdone and way too much salt.  Fries were too greesy and not even tasty.  We just had a couple of bites and left.  I wish I can give negative star.

You could do worse.  

This place does what it's supposed to just fine.  It feeds you junk food.  To anyone with any other kind of expectation than that, you are in the wrong place, buddy.

Burgers, fries, fish sandwiches, pork rib sandwich, philly cheesesteak, hot dogs.  You can't really go wrong if you eat any of these things.  They all taste adequate and their fish sandwich is actually pretty tasty.  The food tastes fresh even though I am fairly certain it is not and I didn't puke afterwards.  That's all I want when I dine at places like these.  The prices are extremely fair compared to everything else on the strip so I give it 3 stars for that reason.

Visited twice during my recent Vegas visit, once for lunch, once for dinner, both times ate at the bar and both times service was very good, a little better during the lunch visit.  For lunch had basic cheddar burger which was very good.  For the dinner visit had the black and blue (blacken seasoning with blue cheese, very tasty.  Both burgers were great.  However, both times i had the garlic and herb fries with my burgers.  This is where they lost a star.  They serve the fries in a metal basket that is shaped like a mini deep fryer basket lined with paper to catch the oil.  However the fries are packed into the basket so the oil is trapped and the fries are soft and mushy.  The first order was tolerable, but the second time was worse.  I'll know better next time.  There are three or four other types of fries and don't know if they result in same mushiness.  There are also many sauces that can be had on the side, though none really appealed to me.  Overall good experience, especially the burger.

Don't be tempted: the menu looks wonderful, but the taste doesn't match.

The Broadway Burger Bar & Grill couldn't have a better location, right in the heart of the New York, New York. And we wanted to try it from the moment we saw the sign. We were disappointed.

We ordered two "Cowboy" burgers and one child's chicken strips meal, all of which proved tasteless. That's a lot of calories and a lot of dollars for not a lot of enjoyment.

Some positives: we were seated immediately, and service was very fast even in the middle of lunch. And the onion rings (with some dipping sauce) were quite nice.

But you don't visit a burger restaurant for onion rings, so let's talk about the burgers. First, Broadway Burger Bar & Grill cooks burgers either "medium" or "well done", so if you like your burger "medium well" you're compromising before you even sit down.

Each burger can be made with beef ("all natural, grass fed, 100% free range Estancia Beef"), chicken, salmon, turkey, or veggie as its heart. And there are more than a few combinations of toppings on the menu. We picked The Cowboy ("Applewood-smoked bacon, barbecue sauce, crisp onions and pepper jack cheese.")

Every word of that sounds delicious. The real things were completely bland. Unseasoned ground beef has more taste at our house than all those wonderful combinations did here. Even with the pepper jack cheese and barbecue sauce, I couldn't find even a hint of spice or flavor in my meal.

With the most basic burger (the "B3&G") costing $9.95, by the time we'd added drinks and onion rings, a meal for two adults and a small child rang up over $50. That's admittedly less than we might have spent at other casino restaurants, where everything is overpriced, but that doesn't make the product worth the price.

In-and-Out burger is just a ten minute walk down Tropicana, and would be a better experience for about a third the cost. Inside the casino, Nathan's (on the second floor) costs about the same but offers a much tastier meal.

The burgers can be customized and are wonderful.  The salad greens are fresh and very tasty!  Try the Greek Burger or the Cowboy.  Excellent selection of craft beers.   Very nice sit down location!  Very friendly employees will help you with selecting sauces and all other ways to personalize your meal to your liking!
On our visit our waitress Lawshanda was very attentive, super nice and provided fast and courteous service! Great food, great experience!!

I was at the New York New York with a friend to have a great time and grab a bite to eat. No other restaurant looked appetizing but when we were greeted by Dawn as we walked by the Broadway Burger Bar and Grill, we knew we found the spot. Her knowledge of the menu, the way she controlled her bar and coworkers was amazing. It was a great time and ended up with excellent food, all at Dawn's recommendation.  
I will be back and because of Dawn, I will recommend this restaurant to all my friends who frequent Las Vegas. Thanks Dawn!
Good burgers and salads. Onion rings way too thick. Chili fries - just ok.

Gluten free burger was soooo good!  Our waitress was super friendly and I got to choose off of a gluten free menu!  So my boyfriend (not gf) and I went for dinner and honestly weren't expecting anything amazing, well we were surprised.  I got the gf option and of course the part that pleasantly surprised me was the gf bun. I haven't had a good gf bun before but decided to try. It was so good!  My bf said it was one of the best burgers he has ever had.  Overall we would definitely tell anyone on the fence to go to this place.  We're in vegas a few more nights and we will for sure be back!

I cannot comment on the food, only the service. There was none! We waited 10 mins for a booth to be cleaned. Mind you there were only 4 tables occupied, hardly busy. When we were seated we waited an additional 15 mins for a server to take our beverage order. She walked past us 3 different times taking another tables order and  just walking around. On the last pass by she said hang on guys i'll be there in a minute. Now, it's 100+ degrees in Vegas and after walking around all day and spending $ we were thirsty. My husband was so parched he even asked the barmaid for something to drink and got equally ignored. She took care of two other guests and just barked at him "i'll be there in a minute" He is a professional and is always polite, her attitude was not called for and the service was a complete failure! Finally after waiting over 20 minutes she asked what I wanted, I said just a water first, had planned on a root beer float. She huffed at me as if it inconvenienced her. I was a sever for 4 years and never once treated a guest like that! I don't understand the attitude, you work in food service, if you don't like it, find another job. Needless to say after the way we were disrespected and ignored for so long we got up and left without being able to eat. HORRIBLE SERVICE, plain and simple. No excuse, they weren't even busy!!

After gaming in NYNY one evening we decided to stop in here and ordered a cowboy and southwestern burger with a side of onion rings. As the other reviewers have said burgers are huge but nice and fresh and a decent price for somewhere on the strip. We also didn't wait too long for them which is always great. Service was good.

Ordered the veggie burger. It tasted OK. The patty fell apart without even picking it up! Service was sslowwwwww. It wasn't like it was busy @ the time we ate there, either! Plus, either waitress forgot to add my onion rings to the tag or the cooks neglected to make them. Not impressed! Next time, I'll go to Burger Bar for a good burger.

Just had a delicious lunch which was made imminently better by the excellent attention of our lively (& lovely) server, Ben. 
The kitchen was great about the food allergy of one of our group, & was happy to accommodate our related requests.

The variety here is great and service is pretty good. The burgers are filling and I loved their chili cheese fries. I particularly liked that they have like 30 condiments to pick from, including wasabe spiced condiments and  all these awesome mustards. Service was attentive. The down was the noise from the renovation going around. Otherwise, not a bad place to grab lunch.

My husband ordered the Cowboy Burger and I got the Asian Salmon Burger. My food tasted ok but my husband's bacon tasted really off. We were both immediately sick. To boot, our waitress was not friendly. Not a good experience. Definitely avoid this place unless you want to risk food poisoning.

Flavor and quality, great! Accuracy of orders, not great. Every time we come here, EVERY time, they prepare one of our burgers completely different than ordered. While they are good to correct it, it does mean we are eating separately as we wait for the incorrectly prepared burger to be cooked properly.

I love this place! It's tucked away in NY NY so it's relatively quiet and commotion free. The burgers are great, the onion rings are great, the beer is great and the service is great. I now make it a point to come here at least once every time I'm in Vegas.

Don't waste your calories here. Their burgers are boring, the buns are tough and the food court ambience makes you feel like you are at a mall.

This is decent before Holsteins (@ Cosmo), but I would never come here again consider a much much better, tastier burger joint being a few hotels away. 

The only good thing is their fries are freshly cut and fried.

I would never eat here again. Extremely expensive and charges you for everything. $4 for an iced tea? $5 for fries and drink upgrade. Had the Philly Cheese steak, kids mac and cheese, and Pork sliders with onion rings. Pork sliders were on Kings Hawaiian rolls, 2 sliders for $6. After eating them I think they are worth about $3. Philly Cheese steak burger was just a cheese burger really. Service was horrible. Our waitress came around twice. The kids mac and cheese was kraft from the box and a large pile of fries for $6, but honestly I think he made out the best of all of us. Even the onion rings were raw and had a fishy flavor like the oil was tainted.

The entire staff was LOVELY.  The burgers are big and juicy (consider sharing). Cherese was are our awesome server. She was really patient with us and guided us in the right direction! Philly Cheesesteak burger is a MUST!!! Loaded fries - YUM!

Dirty

Sat down.  Silverware had goop on it.   wiped it with the napkin, and it smudged.  so it wasn't baked on goop, it was soft goop.

Given plates.  same thing.  goop on it.  wiped it, it smudged.

TOP IT OFF - server brings out my burger.  Just as she rounds the corner when they punch in the orders, she coughs over my burger.  she doesn't turn her head, doesn't cover her mouth, doesn't move the burger.  The brunette server with the crooked face, and lazy, "i don't give a F*@!" expression.  Someone in the food industry should come nowhere close to what she did.

Tony, the manager, was cool.  My waiter was cool.  But place needs to clean house.

well what could i say the burger was good but ive had better, i got the philly cheese steak, i pictured it was a shredded meat type of thing but it was actually a patty, and the meat was kinda dry at that, also u have to select the condiments that you want on a paper, we didnt even get what we asked for, the waitress talked alot! lol but had to ask repeated times to get water and extra sauces. good experience to try something new but i wont be going back.

Other than the prices (my first meal in Vegas so still getting used to the costs) and the bbq sauce I dripped on my shirt this was a perfect lunch. The burger was juicy and had a great taste. 

No refills on the $3+ lemonade was a little ridiculous.

Surprised by the poor reviews. My friend and I thought this place was great. We both had the turkey burgers which were cooked perfectly and very moist which can be hard to find with turkey burgers. They also had a good special where you got a burger, fries and a drink for 14.99. A good deal for dinner in Vegas. The fries were great and they have a huge selection of burger toppings and sauces. Quite good! I also love the location in New York, New York.

I had the Smokehouse burger, A hamburger with brisket on it. Yes, it is as good as it sounds. Drenched in BBQ sauce with all of the classic fix'ins, it was delightful. Topped off with some fresh cut french fries I was stuffed and couldn't eat another bite. Head there if you're a fan of burgers!

There isn't anything wrong with Broadway Burger, per say, but there isn't anything awesome about it either. They have a decent selection of burgers and salads that you can customize. If you are familiar with The Counter, it is sort of like that, but not as awesome.

The service is really friendly and accommodating. I ended up giving my server a really generous tip because she did such an awesome job with a smile. 

The food gets the job done, but it really is nothing to write home about. I felt that I could have done better for my vacation. Then again, I'm not a big burger person and mostly went there because a friend wanted to get a chicken burger (that she didn't like). Meh.

Burgers were very bland.  Fries and onion rings were good.Had to send my burger back because it was so greasy that the bun was completely soaked.  Burger was also over cooked.

Our waitress only came around when our order was taken and then to give us the bill. other than that we never seen her.  count not find anyone to ask questions to.  over all it was not worth the money.

Not sure what was dyer their burger or their service.. I ordered the cowboy burger, it dry as can be flavor was lacking big time. I found out later its suppose to be a healthy burger joint had I known that I wouldn't have went. The waitress was dry no personality like she hated her job or just got dumped.. either way don't kill me vibe. all around bad time will not be back

Everything was excellent. Our burgers were perfectly cooked and juicy. The bun was scrumptious----I rarely finish my bun, but this one was too good to leave even a bite. The fries were exceptional, nice and crispy. I'm very impressed with the overall quality served here. I really think that this was one of the best burgers I've ever had---and being an American who's eaten a lot of burgers, that says a lot!!!

The moment we saw this place we wanted to eat here. We were seated right away but it took a few minutes for the server to come over. Even though she was quite nice she really hasn't tried a lot of items on the menu. Which she was honest about. I was trying to get an opinion on the burgers but she really couldn't sell me both. My bf didn't like the burger he got. He didn't complain but went ahead and just ate the fries and onion rings. They new he didn't like it and the manager did come over to ask if everything was fine. We still didn't say anything. I although enjoyed the cajun salmon. It could of used a little bit more veges on it but it was good with the popcorn shrimp. I would go back and give it another try
I would suggest a pass on this one-ordered burger med-it was well  fries were not even close to warm.  The service was fine and so was the Diet Pepsi-but that's about the best I can say for it

We stay at the NYNY casino frequently and this is one of our favorite places for Lunch/Dinner.
This past week we stayed at Mandalay Bay but were in NYNY and dropped in for a meal before venturing out into the casino.
The hostess and waiter was very friendly (as they all are), sat us immediately and got our drinks quickly.  
The food is always very good, many selections of gourmet burgers and always perfectly prepared and great tasting!!!  

Recommended if you are in the area.

I was at the New York New York lobby at the Strip and looking for a meaty place (burger, steaks, etc.). While walking around I saw this place, and went to sit in the bar.
The regular burger (with no cheese) was surprisingly one of the best burgers I had in years and I am not exaggerating a bit. It was organic and I orderer it to cook as medium well. The burger came out so juicy, tender, flavory and delicious that it literally made my day. I am planning on going there again tonight to get the same burger. And the added bonus is that it was under $10!
Bartender Dawn was funny and pleasant to talk to. We made a few jokes and had a good laugh. She also gave me some good tips on things to see in Vegas.

After walking around for a bit, you may find yourself at Broadway Burger. While my friends were a little put off by the simplicity of the menu, sometimes it is better to do a few things quite well. Our server, David, approached us with a no-nonsense advice of someone who read us as out of towners. Again, put off my friends. I took his recommendation of the berry cooler and the Philly Cheesesteak burger. It was everything he promised. I also took his recommendation to add a little horseradish to the burger. Exquisite.
Good cowboy burger, chili fries (not too big of a portion) Caesar salad, s'western burger.  wait staff 'okay'

30 May 2014, 07:00p

A friend brought me here for dinner after deciding we didn't want to drive anywhere to eat.  He'd been here before and said the food was good so I was game.  The restaurant was fairly empty for a Friday night and we were seated with no problem.  The menu allows for building of a custom burger or ordering one of their Gourmet Burgers or Salads.  We decided on two burgers and we'd share so we could try more than one.  We ordered:

Italian w/Chicken
Southwestern w/Beef

I opted for the Broadway Combo which adds hand-cut fries and a drink for a $5 upcharge.  They allowed me to choose Virgil's Root Beer as my drink, but no free refills, which was fine with me.

Both burgers arrived at the same time and we proceeded to cut them in half ourselves. I thought the Italian was a little more interesting than the Southwestern and my friend agreed that the flavors were more complementary.  The Southwestern was good, but the Italian was better.  Even though there was a lot listed under the Southwestern, it almost seemed like not all of the ingredients were present.

The fries were also good.  They are steak fries so they weren't crispy.  Mine weren't overly salted and they were a little greasy, but they tasted good and the portions are generous.

I wouldn't hesitate to come back and try some other selections from the menu.  The staff was very friendly, the food was good, and the prices are reasonable.
Great beer selection. Awesome service - Bailey was great. Manager Jeff was too. The burger was awesome. I mean you can't go wrong w a bacon cheeseburger w a fried egg on top.
Good burgers but even better chill cheese fries. I ordered the bacon n cheese burger medium rare but it came out med well. The onion rings were good no complaints. Meh but it was ok.

Amazing burgers. The meat is excellent whether you get beef, salmon or whatever. 
I was really happy with the food. But the waiter wouldn't refill our drinks fast enough. I suppose it was too packed to expect otherwise. 
Check this place out if you're at New York New York.
Just gotta day for a quick stop after a full day of flying . This place made our experience here great. The food top notch. The services was great. And  the ice tea was the freshest I have ever had.

Some of the best food we had while in Vegas. We sat at the bar and ordered the onion rings for starters. They were perfect. My husbands burger was cooked to the perfect medium as ordered. The fries were delicious. I had the garlic jalapeno fries. Perfect amount of garlic with very thin slipped fresh jalapenos flaked on top. We had great service by the bartender. I wish we could have ate there atleast one more time before we left Vegas.
Great place for burgers in NYNY. I'm always ready to try a different burger stand and this passed the test! A definite go back restaurant!

Horrible service. Cold fries. Didn't receive one single refill. Tool forever to take my order but the group of 4 that sat down 5 mins after me got their order in before I even had a drink request. Burger was mediocre. Overall disappointment.
Love this place. In the back of the good court area. Great burgers and fries.....sit down experience also, which is a rarity in the Food Court area. Enjoy!

A bunch of my friends and I had a college reunion in Vegas and on the last night there we decided to stop by this place for dinner. The burgers were really good, but the service was SLOWWW!! Not to mention, when one of the food runners (I'm assuming that's what he was) came out with a side of ranch for my friend, and she said thank you, he replied, "My pleasure...(pause)...Not really, they pay me to say that." Um... really?

Minus the snarky dude, we enjoyed the food and had a good time.

This place is great. For me, its been the best food I've had all week on the strip.

If you can, ask for Joe R (the dude with glasses). He was cool and hooked us up with great recommendations, and came by to see us frequently even though it was busy.

I'm a Texan, and I approve of the cowboy burger.

This place was fine. Burgers were good but not the best but not the worst either. Had the philly burgers which was okay. Probably won't get it again. Wife had the English pub burger which was good. Staff was good and attentive. The burger was of good size.

We came here on our first night in Vegas for a bachelorette party after EVERYONE fell asleep and took lame naps while I got anxious and bored. ;) Needless to say I was ready to do things, but our bachelorette wanted food. We wandered and wandered...and wandered. And we ended up here because decisions weren't being made and people were getting hangry/cranky/anxious (including myself). It wasn't my first choice and I can't say I would come back.

I got the seared tuna salad, which was delicious, but the wasabi "dressing" drizzled all over everything was so strong that it basically murdered my taste buds. I love spicy and I love strong wasabi, but this was a shock and just a bit too intense. I wouldn't come back because it  just wasn't worth the money for such poor atmosphere and a lame experience.

WONDERFUL! Fantastic burgers, you get a lot for what you pay for. The Caesar Salad was really great too, enough to share with another person (which my husband and I shared). Wish I had room for the shake and cookies, but we were too full for dessert!

I'm in town for a pharmacy conference that is taking place this week in Las Vegas and let me tell you how hard it is to find a spot to eat without a wait.  A good spot that pumps out good appropriate quality food and at a reasonable price! This is what the Broadway Burger Bar & Grill accomplishes and what makes it a great venue to stop by and check out.  I went with the mushroom swiss burger which was highly recommended by previous yelp users and I must say it is a pretty darn good mushroom swiss burger! And if you're like me who has a ton of questions about what to order the staff will help you out with ease.

I really wanted to like this place, but the food was not good.  I had the Cowboy Burger and ordered it medium.  It came out luke warm and I am perplexed by how they cooked it.  The center was well done, but the outside had was pink.  How does that happen?  The flavor was decent, but every bite had a different consistency.  The highlight of my meal was the onion rings.  Even they needed a little salt, but they were tasty!  On a positive note our server was a sweetheart, even though we dropped $40+ for two incredibly mediocre burgers.

Had the bacon and cheese burger combo. Great food, fast service and great atmosphere. Also had the B3&G tea. A different twist on the Long Island Iced Tea. Thought it was a great drink. The price was reasonable. Also tried the Pineapple Upside Down Cake drink and loved it

Only stopped by the bar for a drink, so don't have much to comment on.
Good prices on beer, great service.
Pickle fries are a MUST!  Fried pickles, but the spears have been cut thinner so they are easier to eat!
Was loud as roller coaster loading/unloading station was right above bar.

BROADWAY BURGER BAR & GRILL
Exploring the food court at New York New York, we stumbled upon this burger joint. We were hungry, so we decided to give it a try. We ordered the salmon burger and some garlic fries. The burger was so-so, and the garlic fries were greasy and didn't have enough of a garlicky taste. It helped stem the hunger, but did nothing to compare itself against the burgers at The Counter.

The burgers are great, but the fries were soggy and undercooked. Our table got the Italian burger, the southwestern burger, the build your own burger, and the chicken sandwich. I'd highly recommend them all! They also have a good selection of condiments.

My god, where do I begin...

Going to not say too much as all around it was terrible so here's a few words to describe the restaurant's environment going in:

Wait time: 1 out of 5

Easy seating, long waits for food (45 mins)
Terrible wait for a chicken BLT and a chicken caesar. I think I could've whipped it up myself in 20 or less if I had everything in front of me.

Food: (0 if possible) 1 out of 5

Chicken (the main protein in our dishes) were dry. I mean it was like eating an eraser. The salad leaves look like it's been sitting out. Not fresh at all. 

Service: 3 out of 5

While there was nothing to serve, the waiter with an English/Australian accent was courteous and polite. She is the only reason I tipped 20%.

If you're looking for service, come to this restaurant. BUT avoid this place at all costs if you're looking to eat.
This was a regular burger place.  Good fries (and plenty of them), and a fairly good patty melt, but nothing amazing.

This is my new favorite Burger place! I don't eat red meat very often, but when it is organic free range burger "and" organic ketchup....you gotta try it!!  I got the Italian Burger with Tropical Tea~ Amazing is all I have to say!

This was my 4th burger I tasted todat and probably the best.   Burger ordered medium rara and cooked perfectly, taste was good.  Lacked a good crust but had good flavor.  The fries were good also but they still had grease on them so that was a downer.  Service was fast and friendly.

I had THE COWBOY! The burger meat was nice and thick. But a little dry so I asked for extra bbq. The fries were some of the best I've had as well as as the chilli. The cheese tasted like nacho cheese, and that threw me off. The service was great, and they were always on top of our drinks and food.

We were headed to Gallagher's to make reservations , but since my hubby wash starving we stopped here .
Quick service , waitress was fun and enjoyable .
Burger was a HUGE ! We are both very full ! 
Oh and it was delicious . 
I like how simple they are , it's a burger bar , no aioli !!! Thank God. Just burgers and fries .
Good drink also !
Would come back . 2 meals 2 drinks 68$

Now, that's a tasty, tasty burger. I got the Cowboy--Applewood Bacon and jalepeno jack cheese. Also got me some onion rings. All around, a very decent burger meal, considering the grill is buried deep inside the New York New York Casino. The burger meat tasted like premium, well-aged beef. The bacon was thick and crispy. The onion rings where piping hot, thick and crunchy. 

What's even better than the burgers at the Burger Bar is the top-notch selection of beers on tap. They had Rogue Dead Guy Ale, Full Sail Amber Ale (representing Oregon--aw-ight!) Stone Arrogant Bastard, Arbita Turbodog, Sam Adams, Firestone Union Jack IPA, New Belgium Mothership, and a couple of others. That's a damn good line-up craft beer line-up. Somebody knows how to pick good brewski at the Burger Bar, that's for sure. Oh, yeah, if you like mass-production crap beer like Bud, Bud Light and Blue Moon, they have that, too.

Friendly, attentive service rounded out my supper satisfaction. I'd go back if I had another day to spend here in LV.

If you just want a good ole burger that is not fancied up like these Vegas gourmet joints, this is the place. I had the ground chicken blta burger and it was delicious. Better than a turkey burger. Big size and fresh. Can't ask for more.
Decent food. Had the philly burger and garlic fries. Person I was with got the convoy burger that looked better. Good beef though.

Great gourmet burgers! We stopped here on a whim because we were looking for a place to eat and watch the Packer football game. There were two flat screen tv's above the bar showing the game with sound so we sat at the bar. They had a lot of good beers on draft for $6.

The bartender was super friendly and helpful. She explained the meat and how fresh it is (i think it's grass fed) and gave us recommendations. My brother got the beef southwest burger. It had pepperjack cheese, jalepeno bacon, and tortilla strip. He loved it! I had a beef greek burger which was uniquely served on pita bread topped with a cucumber greek salad and an amazing cucumber yogure sauce... OMG! The burgers are pretty big so I split an onion ring with my bro. They game with a chipotle aioli sauce I wanted to drink with a straw it was so good! LOL

They are a little pricey but well worth it! 2 burgers, an onion ring, and 6 beers came out to little over $60 bucks.

This is for the Broadway Burger that is located in the New York New York hotel/casino, had dinner late on a Sunday afternoon.

We originally wanted to sit in the dining area, but realized we could also sit at the bar area, that is located on the other side of the hostess station/entry area.  There are two TV's located there so if it is a Sunday, you can watch the game also.

The burgers here are terrific, I had the Bacon & Cheese burger and my companion had the English Pub burger, one side of french fries and one side of onion rings.  The onion rings and fries were awesome, large portions as well.  The gourmet burgers were very large with a selection of side items you can request (Heinz 57, A1 steak sauce, Mayonnaise, etc.) and a good selection of draft beer and drinks.  Our server/bartender was very friendly and helpful as well.

I would highly recommend this restaurant, good service, great location, and terrific food, this is my second trip here and I will definitely go again.
The atmosphere is great just like the service.The burgers are to die for specially when you order whichever hamburger medium rare.mmmmmmmm!!!!
One word. Nasty! Take a walk to burger bar at Mandalay shoppes better service and way better food!!!!

We were unable to find a great restaurant at NYNY, so decided to play safe. You can't go wrong with burgers, right?

Ordered: B3G burger with crispy onions + Chicken BLTA with onion rings.

Decent, but nothing spectacular.

Absolutely awful!

First of all, the place itself looks nicer than the pictures online posted by the restaurant. While the service was super friendly from host to server, the food was not good at all. Also, the table could have been cleaner- for example, the ketchup bottle was a greasy mess which also had ketchup all over it. 

The menu looked appetizing and offered a variety of options. Sadly, the sandwiches were bad. We chose portobello sandwiches thinking we would get a nice, fresh healthy sandwich. It was not! It was a fried portobello that looked like it was breaded by Sysco Co. There was no flavor in the breading whatsoever and it was the skinniest portobello I've ever seen! YUCK! The paremsan crisp on top was flavorless and the random dollops of mozzarella were mildly ok. The garlic fries were ok, but they were soggy. I was hoping for some crispy fries. They tasted edible, so we pretty much ate those and left most of our sandwiches. 

This is not a good place to come, particularly for the portobellos. I would say keep on moving for a sandwich place.

What a disappointment. The drinks were average and that was the best part of the meal. The pub burger had no flavor except for the egg and you have two choices either medium or medium well. The Italian burger was no better, no flavor. Tomato bruschetta was just chopped cherry tomatoes, sad. The fries are cooked fast and sit on the counter while your burger cooks so they end up soggy and not hot anymore. Really, save your money and go to McDonald's, its better than Broadway Bad Burger Bar.

Pros: Service was decent, garlic fries were AWESOME. Big enough for 2 to share.
Cons: Meal was just okay. Had the chicken and brie burger. My friend had a salmon burger and didn't really like it.

Prices are just okay as well, they range from like $10-15 for a burger with fries. We wanted something quick as we had already tried the Cafe at Monte Carlo and walked out (no service after 10-15 mins) so this fulfilled that.
Came by on a whim and it was worth it. The Western Burger was great and the garlic fries packed a punch. The lemonade was excellent. I kind of want to come back tomorrow to try a different burger.

Kids burger/fries
Turkey BLTA
Bacon cheese burger 
Custard shake - chocolate

Sorry.  It just wasn't that good.  For a burger place... the kids burger was sloppy at best.  I would never serve it looking like that.  I wish I took a picture.  Fast food burgers and fries present better than this burger in a basket.  

My sandwich was pretty bland.  Tasted better with the aioli sauce we had left over from the calamari rings we ordered from the fish/chip place across the way.  With the sauce, yum. 

Husband's burger was over cooked and had no flavor. 

The only thing thing worth trying is the custard shake. Honestly, it didn't taste much different from a regular ice cream milk shake, but it was good. 

Friendly service, but on a Tuesday afternoon after the new year, we were only one of three customers there.

The Philly cheese steak burger was really good I highly recommend it the chili cheese fries a little spicy but they were really good and the fact you can build your own Burger as pretty awesome if you're lucky you'll get Dave as your waiter who was really good at recommending burgers and different variety of beers for us
The absolute best sweet potato fries ever!  Burgers look delish but I didn't order that.
Great burgers! Good service! Nice juicy meat tasted great! Our waitress recommended the Southwestern and did not disappoint! Will be back again!
Had a better 6.00 dollar burger at a famous fast food chain.
Great staff and good food. A little expensive but it is what you expect inside of a casino.  We had a wonderful experience and would defiantly go back.

We had a late lunch here today and was pleasantly surprised.  The burgers are HUGE!  It was a perfect medium with lots of flavor.  Neither of us could finish our burger so when we got to the yummy, yummy fries it was impossible to eat them all.  An order of fries will easily suffice for two people.   They have a condiments menu on which you indicate which ones you would like brought to the table - it had a wide selection of mustard, hot sauces, steak sauces, etc.  

We were seated quickly and had a great server, Shannon, who seem to know what we wanted before we did.  She has a strong knowledge of the menu and options and was very pleasant, even with all of my friend's questions and special requests.  

We will definitely be back - next time I'm trying a turkey burger!

Great burger and sweet potato fries.

Kids meals were also good.  My daughter enjoyed the macaroni and cheese.

Nice variety of various proteins besides beef, such as turkey burgers, grilled chicken, salmon and a portobello veg burger.  We had a party of 9 of varying tastes, I was told the beef burgers were good, my chicken was dry with little seasoning. The sides were good the fries and sweet potato fries.  We must have been on the outskirts of the restaurant, because we were either forgotten or not attended to with the service. The server that took our order did not deliver our food, thus she didn't know she mistook an order, we had to send a few dishes back because either the orders were taken wrong or the wrong order was picked up by the runners.  Nonetheless after the mixups or the corrected food orders arrived, the server was pretty clueless that the orders were not correct and we weren't happy.  So if you come here, do not sit outside, as you will be forgotten and not serviced.

Let's put it this way - I ate here 6 times!  I have allergies that severely limit my options for eating out, however, I was able to order straight from the menu without any trouble.  The grass-fed beef burgers were juicy even though I ordered mine well-done, and the bacon is nice and crispy.  I also had the hand-cut fries which were cooked to perfection.  Even though I ordered the same thing each time, the food was consistently great.  And that's not all - the service was absolutely phenomenal!  Each server was genuinely friendly and helpful.  My last 3 visits I had the same server, and she remembered my order from the first time she waited on me.  My husband is very particular about his food, and he loved it.  Next time I'm in Vegas, I will definitely make the trip to this restaurant.

The One Where Sarah Drags Sandy and Friends to get a Burger.

While in Vegas, we randomly were pushed towards a burger joint by my girlfriend ;)  She was craving for a burger and when she saw the neon lights, BAM! there we were... asking for a table for 6.

It was a pretty solid burger joint. I had their English Pub, which was recommended by the server.  Let me tell you, a burger with a fried egg on top is always money! It was just that simple.  A burger with white cheddar cheese and an egg. Delish! Our table was pretty happy with the food and my only complaint was how I wish fries would just come with the burgers instead of being a separate charge. Really?!
We had just arrived in Vegas and wanted something quick but good. The burgers were amazing and reasonably priced for being in Vegas. We enjoyed and will return :)). Great service as well

It was good, not anything to rave about though.  The day we went, it was not too busy, it took a while to get our food. I can't say it was a horrible experience, we will probably try new places next time.
The food was accurate and well prepared and yummy. The best part was David who was engaged and helpful and friendly. He is a great marketing resource for Vegas.

During a previous visit to Vegas, we had eaten here. My son likes it because if you sit in a certain section, you can briefly see the rollercoaster as it returns to the station. So, upon returning to the city, we had to make another stop.

Overall, it is a decent restaurant. The burgers are pretty good. I like that you can make them to order. Although they can get a little pricey if you start ordering sides, etc.

The staff has always been friendly and the food arrives pretty quick. Of course, there were not a lot of people there, so they should be able to get the food out in a timely manner!

And the best part...they were able to accommodate and allow us to sit in the area so that my kids could watch the rollercoaster.

The burgers were all slightly above average and the fries and onion rings were great.  The service was slow and blah. My burger was over cooked but apparently that is what they require.   Medium is over done in my mind.

I had the salmon shrimp burger  (which had a  Cajun flavor to it) with a side of garlic fries.  I must say that the burger was really good. The garlic fries were good as well but too garlicky and all the garlic was at the bottom of the basket and not enough mixed around. I probably would come to have the burger again. The service was good and very welcoming.

My burger us so delicious, get one if you have had a lot to drink and need something filling, I enjoyed my burger I have no complaints about it. I will definitely come back to New York New York for a burger again. Yummy
My bacon cheese burger was delicious
Great burgers. Greats beers. Who could ask for more? Just had the black and blue burger and it was just as good as last year. So happy we found this place.

In a sea of expensive food options it was refreshing to find Broadway Burger Bar was fairly reasonable. 

The burger options are great and feel the specials offer enough variety and a good value vs customizing your own. 

Quality of the food is adequate, won't blow your mind but will do its job to satisfy you without over paying. 

Overall Thoughts

I would say that if you are looking for a value option that isn't a chain or food court, Broadway is a good way to go

Two words- PICKLE FRIES! Yummy crispy fries and food and a very convenient location. We had excellent service too even with it being kind of busy. My husband enjoyed his burger and fries too and the atmosphere of the restaurant was nice.

Unfortunately our party didn't notice the condiment menu until after our burgers were served, but overall we enjoyed our food. We just had to ask for condiments afterward.  Service was on point.  I ordered the upside down pineapple cake cocktail  and it was delicious. They only give you a choice of medium rare or well done on your burgers, which may be a good thing because I ordered mine medium rare and it was perfect.

We brought a party of 5 to lunch here and really enjoyed the experience.  We ordered 3 different burgers, the Ahi and the Smoked Chicken salad, all excellent, especially the panko breaded goat cheese accompaniment. Very decadent.  The Manager, Jeff, was very gracious and visited with our Mom and Aunt and made excellent suggestions for our drink and dessert choices. We stayed at the table and visited for quite awhile and never felt rushed by the wait staff.

This was a great stop for dinner! I will def come back for not only the burgers and fries but the great service Joe R. gave us.  He was so helpful with recommendations... I was pleasantly surprised with my overall experience.  Oh, btw the on tap IPA beers are great too.

For those who don't want a burger made with beef you have the option of a chicken, salmon, turkey, or veggie patty. Had the bacon chesse burger and onion rings. For less than $20 a person in vegas had a great meal. Asked for ranch for the onion rings and the waiter not only brought it out but brought an aioli sauce that tasted awesome with the onion rings.  My husband got the black and bleu burger with sweet potato fries.  I'm personally not a big fan of sweet potato fries but they were the perfect combination of sweet and salty that I found myself sneaking them off his plate.  Both burgers were cooked perfect.  I will definitely go here the next time I'm in vegas.

I visited this place because it looked really appealing, so in i went and sat down in the booth that was "outside" the restaurant but in the hotel's street of restaurants (actually looked like a city street) so i could people watch.

At First the service was acceptable, we put in our drink order and then the food order. I ordered a specialty drink that was pretty good and an appetizer (Mozzarella wedges)  that i thought was really good as well.

It seems the service dropped off after that....but i'll touch more on that later.

The burger i ordered came, i ordered a "Southwestern burger" that had tortilla strips and a spicy sauce.....I thought it was pretty good and it seemed the prices weren't too outrageous either which is a huge plus on the Las Vegas strip!

So now that we know the food is good i must tell you about the server....simply put she disappeared. Nowhere to be found. Drinks stayed empty, and we had to look around frantically until a Manager noticed us looking and had him bring our bill......ugh....not good service.

I'd give it another whirl (just because i liked the food)....but the service had better greatly improve if i were to come back after that.

The burger just wasn't very good. The bun was dry. The patty has no flavor. The waitress was terrible. We waited 30 minutes and asked the waitress if the burgers are close to being ready because the show is about to start. She said the burgers have to cook and walked away. Not to mention she never brought my friend his water. Just terrible.

One of the best burgers I have had in a long time. Their garlic fries are great too. Our server was very quick abd attentative. I will definitely come back the next time I am in vegas. The greeter was also very cheerful when we walked up.

First of all the host didn't even greet us until we said something and then she walked us to our table with no smile and just threw down the menu and walked away. Then the server took forever to come to our table to take our order and the food took EVEN LONGER we waited over 30 minutes for less than mediocre burgers. We ordered the Philly Cheesesteak burger and all I tasted was the dry tasteless beef patty and nothing else. The Chicken BLTG was no different it was just dry and bland. The burgers are definitely not worth the price of $11-13. We were not satisfied at all after the meal. We then sat for another 10 minutes in order to get the check. The only positive thing was the server was nice. This place was one of the worst places in Las Vegas that I have eaten at out of all the Burger Places on the strip.

Really good burger joint located inside the NYNY Hotel & Casino. 

FOOD
+ Bacon and Cheese Burger ($12.95): My medium-rare beef patty was cooked to perfection. Juicy, well-seasoned, and loved that it was grass fed, free range, all natural and hormone free. You can really taste the difference.
+ Fresh Hand Cut Fries ($3.95): Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside. Nothing soggy about it. Delicious.

SERVICE
Dave was our excellent waiter. On top of his game. Tip him well!

CONCLUSION
Without a doubt, I will not hesitate to come back when in Vegas.

We gave B3 &G a go once we saw their menu - great idea: they have about a dozen varieties of burger classics, and then you choose your burger: beef, chicken, turkey, veggie, and maybe a fish something. 

I went with the Chicken BLTA and without even double-thinking, I assumed it'd be a marinated, grilled chicken breast. Unfortunately I assumed incorrectly. It was a ground chicken patty with some kind of seasoning all mixed in. I didn't love the seasoning. 

The garlic and herb fries rock! You'll definitely want to bring some gum or a gallon of Listerine to combat the garlic breath. At least vampires will steer clear. 

Our server, Tony, was cool enough. Leaving, I had only one closing thought: $5 for a pint of Bud Light? What the?!
Fantastic burgers! Ask for Dave M! Best server ever! He was so knowledgeable about everything Vegas! Loved the Berry Cooler as well.

Came here for dinner after a loooong 7 hour drive from Lake Powell, UT to Vegas.  Definitely satisfied the need for some good post-road-trip grubbage.

What I liked:
They offer chicken, turkey, beef, and veggie burgers.  
Their fries are super yum!
I ordered a chicken burger which was solid.  My dining companion got a beef burger and reported it "very good."

What I didn't like so much:
The service was SLOOOOW (though friendly).

Maybe a bit above and "a-ok" experience but not quite  "yay, I'm a fan."  If I could, I'd hit it with 3.5 stars.

Stopped by here to have lunch, because we were in NY, NY to pick up show tickets...  Seemed a little pricey for lunch.  Burgers were over $10 each and didn't include any sides.  I think I spent almost $30 for two people and that was only for 2 burgers, one order of onion rings, and tip (no drinks, since we had already gotten Starbucks).

I guess the cool thing here is that you have a choice of meat patties (beef, chicken, turkey, salmon, veggie) and can mix/match the type of burger that you want.  They also have a plethora of condiments that you can choose to have brought to the table.  The burgers themselves were just okay...  Could have used a little more seasoning on the pattie itself.  It was good, but nothing special.  The onion rings were great, but didn't get that many in a single order.

This place is located in NY NY Casino Hotel in Las Vegas.

We came here to have lunch one afternoon.
I ordered the Fresh Salmon burger on a wheat bun and my bf got a Cheese Burger and garlic fries.

Ok, salon burger was so fresh, i swear they must have a sea in the kitchen or something. I was really impressed with the freshness and taste. Pretty large size also. Loved it.
Cheese Burger was good, step up from fast food but nothing gourmet.

Waitstaff was really pleasant. The manager actually brought our food out and came to check up on us once more.
The atmosphere blends well with the hotel.

I wouldnt go out of my way to eat here,its not a Vegas specialty place, but if its convenient, then yes.

Worst burger ever !!! No flavor at all tasted like a frozen patty very dry, were were told that the patty was lean.  Would have been nice to know ahead of time.  Garlic fries were good.  Don't waste ur money !!

Delicious! Good atmosphere.
Fun.
Best waitress in Las Vegas so far on this 5 day vacation is Lashawnda!!
Sweet, attentive and kind! 
Thank you

Every casino, seems now days, has a top end burger joint.  This one is NY NY's place.  It ain't high end.  More reminiscence for a walk out counter, but you can sit down and order off the menu.  Much better than any fast food joint.  Much better.  But not as good as the other casino burger joints.

They just reopened this spot, after months of renovation. Now it is a more proper sit down diner. You check in, the host seats you- that kind of thing. 

The food is so mediocre, I'd eat at Carls, and Mc'Dees before here.

We stopped by to have a late night bite to eat.  We ordered a basic burger which was quite tasty.  I loved that they had grass fed beef and organic offerings.  Coming from Seattle, we're kinda food snobs when it comes to those things.  Its a little pricey but worth it.

We came here before going to see Zumanity. Two of us had a salmon salad, one salmon burger and a regular burger plus onion rings, garlic fries and sweet potato fries. Ashley, our server, was very attentive, made sure our water and drinks were refilled and was otherwise the kind of server one would want.

Food was good and priced fairly. I'd recommend it if you want good American.

We grabbed dinner here our first night in Vegas. It was fine; no complaints here. The burgers were cooked like we like and they tasted good, portions were plenty. However, I think next time we are here we might try a different spot if we want burgers. It was a bit pricey for having to order fries, etc., on the side (For $10-15, you just get the burger). Plus, I think you could find something more unique.
The turkey burger is still one of the best I've ever had.  Careful, though; one of those and some onion rings and some of your wife's fries is a successful recipe for one serious gut bomb.

The burger here was delicious! You get a huge beef patty, the buns are super soft, and I ordered extra pickles! I'm not sure why it has such low stars but I found this place to be pretty good and super close to my hotel.....plus it wasn't Mcdonalds and it didn't make my tummy ache! Perfect meal to aid in any hangover while your in Vegas. And very affordable too!

The Bella Burger is delicious! It's a portabello mushroom with panko. It's a vegetarian burger, but very "meaty" and delicious. I was reeeally hungry and felt like I could have eaten at least 1 1/2 of those burgers. I usually can't finish my meal, or I am completely stuffed if I do eat everything, but the size of the burger didn't leave me completely satisfied. I would definitely eat this again though! SO GOOD!!! :9

While looking for something to please all picky taste buds on my Birthday. We stumbled upon The Broadway Bar and Grill located inside the NYNY hotel casino on the "Streets of New York" promenade.  This area is filled with different restaurant outlets primarily serving quick service comfort food. 

The burgers we tried were delicious.  I had the Italian topped with bruscheta style tomatos, aioli, and parmesan crisp.  My Burger was cooked slightly less than I prefer and came out more medium rare than medium. It was still tasty. 

We also tried the Bella Burger which was a portobello mushroom stuffed with cheese and coated and fried in panko bread crumbs.  Very delicious! 

All burgers are served a la carte. Sides are an additional  $4 to $5 but are a filling portion to share between two people.  We tried the pickle fries which were very good. Our order came out hot and coated with a light batter and we're still in a spear like shape.  They were missing a dipping sauce of some kind to enhance the flavor.  Even a ranch served on the side would be an improved taste.

Service was welcoming and attentive. I liked that they have a patio area which feels like your outside without being out side, it's a great place to people watch. Overall good creative and traditional burger recipes and prices were typical of Las Vegas Strip restaurant. Come hungry...leave happy.

We went here twice during our last visit in April. service was good. burgers big and fries, there were plenty. they have a combo that is 14.95 for a burger fries and a drink, cant beat that. plus you get a big dill pickle!

I had the portobello burger.  It was deep fat fried and overcooked.  The bun was burned and all that came on the hamburger was lettuce and tomato.  Way overpriced for $10 (no fries and no drink with that price).  I also got the sweet potato fries and my friend got the onion rings.  Both were very good.  If they had been bad, I would have given this review a one star.

Awesome! Grabbed burgers here with my boyfriend and his brother and girlfriend the day before NYE. We all loved our burgers and fries. I'm celiac and got a gluten free bun and omission beer! ChaChing! Sweet potato waffle fries are awesome too. Would recommend to anyone and definitely eat here again!
Love the garlic fries and burgers. All so fresh. Always get the cowboy, but don't forget to ask for pickles, lettuce, tomatoes and onions. The hamburger doesn't come with them.

Good variety of burgers on the menu. Can also opt to build your own with burger, chicken, turkey and I think even veggie. Hubby enjoyed his bacon and cheese, a traditional bacon cheeseburger with English cheddar. I opted for the chicken bltg. The pepper bacon and the guacamole (which had a jalapeño kick) were complimentary to one another. The chicken was also cooked well, moist and juicy.  For $5 extra you can tack on a soda and fries. The portion of fries looked like it was enough to serve two. Can't speak to the flavor as didn't order the combo meal. They also offer shakes from the Ben and Jerry's across the way. The draft beer list was peppered with west coast microbrews like deschutes and full sail.

We walked into New York New York not knowing what or where we were going to eat . Stumbled upon a nice looking burger joint and we entered. The ambience was nice and we where say very quickly regardless of our party of seven. Our servers name was Kelsey and it was the first time we had been introduce by a resturuant work on a first name business. She was personable and on top of that she knew all of the beers the burger bar had on draft. As a working in the food an beverage industry this was very impressive and I admire her for going the extra mile. She answered all questions about the menu options and on top of of that she brought us all the condiments we asked for BEFORE the entrees arrived. Nothin gets me more fired up that getting my ranch thirty minutes after I get my French fries. The runner accurately gave everyone their food and apologized when he made a mistake. On to the food. The burgers where great, the garlic fries where amazing and it all came it out in an appropriate amount of time. All in all it was amazing wonderful and perfect.
The panko crusted Portobello mushroom burger was ok it had a pretty good crunch. The food was good for a late night eat.

Holy smokes. Absolutely AMAZING!  It's in the New York, New York and is the best burger I've ever had. Great service and value. We will be back before the end of our trip. The pickle fries are heavenly.

Offically, this is blind suqirrel finding nut, well actually to die for burger.  So, Mr Tourist goes to Vegas and spents eight hours in airports to eat a Pastrami Burger at Ameirica, different restuarant.  Which happened to close post superbowl or yesterday.  Mark is now in search for anything burger like. On tuesday night, the place was half full but its a casino so gamblers are busy elsewhere.

Now this is my first time ever hearing the term Estancia beef  (from Uruguay), it is damn near perfect.  Okay, besides the obvious burger choices the menu includes Black & Blue (with Roquefort cheese), English pub burger with grill tomato and egg, Southwestern with jalopena bacon & guac, & Philly Cheesesteak Burger (with shaved ribeye steak).  I opted for Black & Blue, it came straight down from burger heaven.  A fine pink stripe as ordered medium, lots of Roquefort cheese oozing off and I attempted to eat it. The Philly Cheese steak burger was very good, too.  Both were very juicy, needed plenty of extra napkins!!  And if you must have fries with burger (like its optional), go for garlic fries.  They have an interesting way of making them, they use minced garlic!!!  Lots of garlic and one serving was more than enough for two. You can get about 6 differnet mustards and four types of mayo.

But like is not all burgers, they have beer! On draft varieties includ Stone Arrogant Bastard Ale, Full Sail Amber Ale, Rogue Dead Guy Ale, Abita Turbodog Brown Ale, Three monkeys Nut Brown Ale, and the list goes on to less important beers.  Really nice "little" place in Mega Casino Land.  Great staff, quick service, friendly and helpful with selections.  So if you're in Las Vegas and need a burger in the worst way, head to New York New York.  And if you dont want a burger they will prepare chickie, turkey,  salmon, and veggie patties the same way.All burgers $10-$13.

We went yesterday before WWE. We just wanted to grab something and we were like this will be ok. But it was absolutely yummy. My son and my husband and I enjoyed everything. The burgers were awesome and the chili cheese fries were amazing. The service was great. We are so happy to find another local place to go to. The prices for being on the strip were great too. Really enjoyed it. It's really hard these days to get good food and good service. We will definitely be going back.
Bread was tough . Not much flavor . Not worth the money fries where greasy and only barely warm

My wife and I ate here recently, and we enjoyed it so much we ate here again two days later.  As others have mentioned, the restaurant sits inside the New York/New York Casino, near the Zumanity Theater, and it wasn't listed in the guide books, so it was a pleasant surprise to find. Their specialty is burgers, of multiple styles, and they are large, so it was all you could do to finish it when ordered with a side of fries.
I had a British burger, with fries and a fried egg topping a generous beef burger, and my wife had the chicken burger, and the veggie burger on the second trip. The servers were very friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere feels like a outdoor cafe. The only negatives were that it sits below the roller coaster and can get noisy when the coaster is running, and if you order a milk shake, they run across the hall to get it from the ice cream place across the way. Not too bad in the Cons department. So...Staff - A Food - A Atmosphere - B+

We stopped by New York New York to pick up our Zumanity tickets and stumbled upon Broadway Burger Bar & Grill. It's located towards the back of the casino, close to the Zumanity theater. The whole decor of New York New York is a little kitschy but still cute!

We were promptly seated and our server was really sweet. She gave us plenty of time to look over the menu, which offers basic burgers, specialty burgers, salads, and tons of appetizers. We decided to share an order of chili cheese fries ($4.95) and also ordered the B 3 & G burger ($9.95) and B 3 & G turkey burger ($9.95). The burgers are only cooked two ways, pink or well-done.

We both really enjoyed our burgers, they were huge and very filling, but felt that the chili cheese fries were just okay. They gave us big portions though!

Overall, Broadway Burger Bar & Grill is a perfect spot for lunch in the casino and great for sharing.

***** 10% Locals Discount *****

Broadway Burger Bar is located inside the New York New York Casino over near the Zumanity theater and Race and Sports Book. 

After reading some of the reviews, I wasn't quite sure what to expect in terms of service. I have to say that we were quite pleased with the service we received here. Our hostess greeted us with a smile and promptly seated us. The waitress followed shortly thereafter and took our orders. I decided to play it safe and just get a cheeseburger($9.95) and fries($2.95), while my friend opted for the chili cheese burger($11.50).

 Both of our burgers were quite tasty and the patties were so thick and juicy! They seem to take great pride in the fact that their burgers are 100% free-range, grass fed Estancia beef.  This means they are all natural with no hormones and no antibiotics! Nice! Fries were nothing spectacular, but the portion size was healthy.

We were checked on repeatedly by our waitress and never had to ask for our drinks to be topped off. We were very pleased with the service here.

I noticed some people complained about the prices, but considering you are on the strip, the prices are not bad at all. Actually it's not too much more than you would pay at a Chili's or Applebee's off the strip...so suck it up,cupcake!

I would definitely come back here again for a quick, casual bite to eat if I find myself in NY-NY again!


4 stars.

Had to wait for a long time to be served. Bad food old dried chicken salad from Costco bag, mediocre burgers.
I recommend avoiding this place

Friendly staff, good service, but boy... what a great burger, started selecting a good amber beer, then I was recomended by my server Lashawnda to have this southwestern burguer with tortilla chips and guac inside, soft fresh bun, smoked bacon and cheese... jalapeno mustard and habanero tabasco on the side... boy... im gonna remember this experience, I've been to buffets and fine dinnings in my 5 day vegas stay and this has been the best meal by far... manager approached the table to ask about our experience, he also seemed very confident in what they serve, that made me feel even better on my already great burguer.

Stopped by for a quick bite to wet our appetites. Appetizer is Crispy Green beans. I'm trying the Southwestern burger and fresh cut French Fries. 
This place hit the spot!
Service was good but the food was absolutely blan and left a lot to be desired. There are much better burger joints on the strip!

Great service and the food was spot on as well!! OK - Crystal was our waitress and I asked her what she liked the best - hands down the Salmon - I had the. Cali - and was she ever right. NO binder. 100% House made salmon patty that was so flavourful and moist.  O rings rocked as well. Good beer selection and a nice quiet place where a conversation is possible. Well managed and friendly.  Highly recommend.

What a terrible way to be lectured by the hostess.  She reprimanded me for looking at there display of 20 +\- condiments.  You would of thought I just crashed a vehicle into her and was drunk.  

Was one of my worst all time interactions between a hostess as a patron in my 56 years on the planet.  Had it not been for the beer battered onion rings I would of left.  

She told me I had no business standing there looking at there 20 condiments as they would bring it to me.  I was in a location where I wasn't allowed, she stated in front of her staff.  Go figure it was not inside the kitchen and it was a lecture from not a kind hearted staff member. 

She knows her job but never again.  Learn how to speak to your guest and Management take notice.
Don't bother with the happy hour unless you're wanting beer only. You only get two sliders so don't order if you're hungry.

"I like the environment and the food is good too". I decided on  their "Black & Blue Burger" with a side of Sweet Potato Fries cut Waffle Style. "This burger was delicious!" If you're not a fan of French Roquefort Cheese, I wouldn't recommend it because the cheese is "VERY" strong in taste in which I loved. The only reason I gave this place 4 stars is because our waitress. She wasn't horrible, but could have payed attention to the table a little more when we asked for condiments and finally received them 10 minutes later. Perhaps a busy day, "I don't know". Other than that I would still recommend this place because the food made up for the service we received.
Really good food, Philly cheese steak burger was amazing... you can choose healthier options with lettuce wraps or turkey or salmon patties. Would definitely recommend.

DELICIOUS FOOD SERVED UP HOT AND FRESH in a good mock up of a NY subway station in the New York New York casino.

We started with an order of fried pickles, which were YUM!! Kosher dill spears in a crispy wet cornmeal batter had been fried perfectly. They come with ranch, but I liked mine better without the ranch so all that big pickle flavor could shine through!

I got the Swiss and Mushroom burger, which was cooked perfectly medium rare just as I had asked. I am so used to getting medium burgers (ordered medium rare) that I was thrilled!! 

Apart from being cooked correctly, the need was well seasoned with salt and pepper, came with a generous amount of delicious sautéed mushrooms (crimini and shiitake), and a flavorful melted aged Swiss on a toasted fresh-baked bun. Just a delicious burger - the best I've had in a long time. 

Others at the table enjoyed their Italian burger, which came with a delicious thick Parmesan cheese crisp that was to die for!! 

We would definitely come back, EXCEPT we had to walk through the casino to et to the food court in back. Smoking is allowed in Las Vegas casinos, and by the time we were in and out, my asthmatic girls had breathed in so much smoke that they both needed nebulizer treatments. Even the one whose asthma is well controlled needed a treatment -- that's how bad the combined cigar and cigarette smoke in the casino is, despite a massive HVAC system. The air in the food court (nonsmoking) was VASTLY better, but be damage had been done and the girl's chests were feeling the effects. 

What a shame we can't come back -- the food was delicious, service friendly and efficient, and atmosphere interesting and exciting.

: Amazing good food, and our server David is always a pleasure. We came here once on my stay-cation birthday weekend, we enjoyed the food drinks and service so much we had to come back again, and request to sit in David's section.
Good burgers... Onion rings were quite tasty too.  The service and food was pretty fast too.  Located inside New York New York hotel.

This place is in New York New York. They allowed us to bring our stroller when other places wouldn't. The lady that helped us was rad and went out of her way to make the kids happy. The burgers were perfect. They were juicy and the best. It was amazing. The side salad was great as well.

We stopped by here before the Zumanity show for a few drinks. We didn't eat, but the food next to us looked and smelled great. We sat at the bar, on the outside of the general eatery.Our bartender was very personable and she poured great drinks. Just a few steps away from the theater and you can take the bar drinks in with you.

I went here twice this week.  Tuesday the grass-fed burger (medium) and onion rings were good.  However, the service was a bit slow.  I almost thought they forgot my order.

Wednesday the burger was better (I asked for well done this time) was great.  However, the onion rings were crispy on the outside but mushy on the inside.  They were almost inedible but I wasn't that hungry, so I didn't say anything. Also, my friend's fries were soggy.  The service was better, though.

A couple other reviews mentioned soggy fries, so their consistency needs to be improved.

My husband and I are here for our last dinner in Vegas. I really wasn't in the mood for anything in particular... He was ready to eat his own arm. As we walked through New York New York, we saw "Broadway Burger Bar" and decided to look no further.

I found the menu (somewhat) limited. My husband went with the Cowboy Burger which had bacon, (pepper jack) cheese, onions and BBQ sauce on it. He is lactose intolerant and can't do pepper jack cheese so he asked if he could get provolone instead and the server said there was an up charge for provolone... I personally have NEVER heard of an up charge for a cheese switch, especially provolone???? He then asked for it to be cooked Medium Well and she said they ONLY cook the burgers medium or well...
