Personally have NEVER heard of only 2 temps either. Weird. Sides do not come with the burgers so you pay extra if you want fries. They do have a combo where you get a burger and add fries and a drink for $5 more (which is what he did). He said the burger was really good but unfortunately having it well done made it dry (but he was nervous getting it med). The fries were great too, fresh cut.

I ended up choosing just a house salad. I asked if I could get romaine lettuce instead of the lettuce it was supposed to come with. There was a looooooooooong pause... And I continued, "Or is that a problem??" Eventually she said I could have romaine. (Almost then asked if there would be an up charge for that switch). The description said the salad came with a "sherry vinaigrette" but I get weird with dressings, they can make or break a salad so I asked for it on the side. It ended up being good BUT I wouldn't call it a vinaigrette... It was a creamy dressing similar in consistency to Caesar or ranch. I see vinaigrette and I think more or a thin Italian-like, oil & vinegar dressing. 

Iced tea cost $4. Yikes. Seemed high.

Server was ok. She wasn't super friendly but did her job. 

All in all, food was good and came out fast. They'll charge you for everything extra. I'd say we'd be back but I like to try new restaurants.

Zumanity burger
Cajun salmon burger
Long wait for food
Soggy fries
Burgers were good
Pickle is good

Yum! This was our first meal in Vegas while we were waiting for our room to be ready at the MGM Signature. I had the greek burger which I am still thinking about a month later! Service was fast and friendly. The place is great for people watching, especially by the humanity theater. We came back for dessert another time after seeing Zumanity, the brownie sundae was also wonderful! We will come back next time we are in Vegas. I give it five stars, because I really don't have a single complaint!

If you want to eat grease this is the way to go. Got a portobello burger, thinking it would be a great healthy alternative, instead it was deep fried and tasted like a funnel cake. Great if you're into that, I am not. The sweet potato fries tasted good the cut fries were like downing oil with a potato taste. Also the honey mustard is a bottle of preservatives and, unsurprisingly, tastes terrible. I will admit I am extremely picky and health conscious, naturally it was an overall a disappointment.

One of the best mushroom burgers I have ever had, its crispy and not slimy like most. The fries and pickle fries are good as well. The place is a little small but the service is so great I will definitely make my way back when Im in town.

We stopped here for a late lunch after picking up Zumanity tickets at the NYNY box office which is literally right next to this restaurant. The restaurant is spacious and clean, service was quick and friendly, prices were comparable to any burger place on the strip. The food was delicious. I ordered the burger with French fries, aged white cheddar, and a fried egg on top. Recommended by the waitress I also added bacon. Delicious!!! This is a tasty and convenient spot I'd recommend for lunch.

Some of the best burgers I have had.

Juicy, tenderness in every bite.

My daughter and I shared the Philly Cheesesteak burger. It was huge. 

We also had a basket of garlic fries, they were delicious.

Service was fast and friendly.

Food was great, service was awesome, the wait was not so good.  I'd give a 5 star review but for as few people as there were in the restaurant, it took an awful long time for our food to show up.  Overall we left happy but I can't help but get a bit discouraged especially when you're hungry.  Am I right or am I right or am I right?

Stumbled into the New York New York Casino around 3 a.m. and this was the only restaurant open.  (It's not usually open that late, but the other restaurant was temporarily closed.)

I ordered the Cowboy burger - applewood smoked bacon, barbecue sauce, crisp onions and Pepper Jack cheese.  It hit the spot as a late night option.  The cheese was only barely melted, which was a disappointment.

The fries were relatively bland, but there were enough to share.

I'm not sure if the preparation is better during the daytime, but this is a fairly decent food option if you're in the area.
David our waiter was amazing! Food was great "the Philly" was great, Chicken and Brie was great. Highly  recommend. Must try!
Food was just ok. Expensive for what little you get. 2 burgers, 2 sodas and 1 fry. $40.
Philly cheese steak burger and garlic fries were both amazing. My wife ordered the pork sliders and chicken wraps which also were great. Very friendly staff and a great happy hour prices.

Two choices, pink in the middle or well done, I don't like pink when it comes to burger so got well.  More like over cooked and bland!  There are way better burger places in town, wish I had gone to one of those instead of trying this place!
Horribles burgers; burn garlic fries and expensive for 10 bucks i will get way better burgers at in and out two starts just because the milkshakes are good

Oh My! The veggie burger is YUM! And the sweet potato fries? Crispy hot and flavorful. Now my mistake forgetting to X on the tomato, cause December not the time for them but from the service, presentation and flavor? Awesome on all counts! We will be back

For all the great reviews on Yelp I was disappointed.  Especially when I looked in the kitchen to see the head Chef chomping on a Big piece of gum, with his mouth open!  The burger was pretty good but not that special.  The onion rings were just okay too.  My wife and I split a burger, onion rings and a shake.  The only thing we finished was the Ben n Jerry's shake.  We could have gotten just that across the hall at Ben N Jerry's and avoided the burger that is priced for 2 but sized for 1, even if we didn't finish it.  It was anticlimactic after reading all the great the reviews here and Google.  Good burger but nothing special.  The cheapest burger is $10.50 and has No meat if that tells you about pricing.  Maybe the chef missed the special sauce on ours?

Fantastic!! All the food I've tried here is great.  However this is the very best veggie burger I've ever tried!!  Ever!!   It's a grilled portobello mushroom patty. I'm by no means a vegetarian but this sammich is the best item on their menu.  Their onion rings are pretty tasty as are their fries.  The black and Bleu burger is also tasty but could use a little more flavor.

DO NOT GO HERE!!!! This is by far the worst place to go when the Golden Knights are playing. We went in for a burger and a salad. After 40 minutes of waiting we had to flag down our waitress that never came back after taking the order to please go check on our food as we have to get to the game. After another 10 min I found our waitress in the kitchen talking with other employees and the manager. I told the manager that this was very poor service and he said ......SORRY MAN......Nothing else...I told them to sick that food up their but and try to provide much better service. We left with no food, no apology, and with no customer service.....If you like being treated like crap.....This is your place...LOL....We will never go there again. Thankfully there are a lot of other choices.

Nice ambiance and friendly service. Always points for old fashioned booths.

I ordered a plain burger, no cheese, no bun to accommodate my food sensitivities. The burger arrived with tomatoes and large pieces of butter lettuce which is optimal for making a lettuce wrap. There were no other basic garnishes like onions or pickles. They only do medium and well done.  Minus a point for not offering medium rare.

Ordered pickle on the side which was whole and quite perfect. And ordered onions which were nice and thin.

My eating companion loved his bacon burger with toasted onion and BBQ sauce.  

We had pork belly sliders which were good, and probably did not even need all that BBQ sauce. Pork belly mmmm.....

Limited selection of meat for a burger place. Chicken, beef, salmon and veggie. Wish they offered lamb, or other meat options.

Extra points for using pastured beef. It was a decent burger and slathered with mayo and Dijon, quite tasty. Next time I will make a point of adding more fixings for more flavor. The burger alone did not stand out.

Broadway is reasonably priced overall, but what made it better was that their servings are so big.  With 4 people we ended up just ordering 2 burgers and 2 fries.  We all left stuffed!  Quality burgers freshly made!  The onion rings were good, as were the sweet potato fries.  Best part - you can customize your burger!  Service was also outstanding!

This is my experience here with my family.  We were walking by and looking at the menu to find no kids items but wait the host handed us a kids menu with out even asking us what we were looking for they had mac and cheese just what my boys wanted so we went in. Our waiter was awesome he took our boys order while me and my wife were looking at the menu. After a few minutes we asked for help deciding as everything looked so good. He told us 2 good burgers then he told us if we split a combo it would save us money so we did and let me tell you the burgers were top notch the chef  is awesome.  Service was awesome just all around will come back and tell all my friends.
My family of four really enjoyed our burgers! Our waiter, Ben, was so  attentive, pleasant, professional and knowledgeable about the menu. We had a delicious lunch!
Superb service & the food was outstanding. Maybe we hit on a good night. Wide selection of meats & toppings. Onion rings are the bomb!

Stopped in before our we went to see Zumanity. Their menu is pretty basic and moderately expensive for what it is. Most likely wouldn't go again based on lack of selection on the menu and lack of flavor. Basic burger joint even though I ended up ordering a Caesar salad

The service was wonderful. Grass fed beef burger was fantastic.
Amy our server was very friendly and attentive. Tony the manager was friendly, very professional came over to check on us.
Overall being a Las Vegas local eating on the strip can be expensive and annoying, this was a nice experience.
Great Swiss and mushroom burger!  Half pound.  Was juicy and tasty.  Onion rings were excellent.  Will be back. Joe did a great job!

This place is great. Has possibly turned into my go-to happy hour every time I return to Vegas. 
I sat at the bar and was served by Dave the bartender who was friendly and had great advise when it came to ordering. 
Be aware of the crazy roller coaster at the New York New York that breaks pretty much right on top of where you are sitting (if you're sitting at the bar). 
The bar staff is very willing to offer beer (draft) samples or tastings if you're unsure of what you want.
Get an 805 and a shot or 2 of Jaeger and keep it moving ... it is Vegas. 
TELL DAVE WHATS UP!!!

Fantastic burger and fries. 
I stopped by there today and got the mushroom and Swiss burger and it was amazing! The meat was very thick and cooked perfectly, the mushrooms were sautéed just right and the cheese was a big thick slice of the best tasting Swiss you'll ever eat. The fries were crispy and very well seasoned. 
By the way, forgot to mention, but the above was so great, even after I got it to go and drove home 25 minutes!

To all the people who want to stand outside Shake Shack in the cold for 20 minutes for a tiny burger no more impressive than a Big Mac, do your taste buds a favor and step inside the NY NY and get a REAL burger!
Grass fed beef. Can't go wrong there. No complaints about the burger. The beef was juicy and the jalapeño bacon had exactly enough heat. Just wished the fries had a little more seasoning, though.

The service here is good, our server Jaimie was great and the yummy Tropical iced tea was never empty. I had the ahi steak salad which was cooked nicely but I recommend asking for the dressing on the side.
The burgers and fries are amazing! They have a gluten free bun option, which always makes a Celiac happy! The server and manager were very friendly and attentive.

Tasty food and probably some of the best drinks for the price we had in Vegas!  Our waiter was great with the recommendations both at the restaurant and beyond (wish I could remember his name), but he was brutally honest about all things Vegas and pretty entertaining.  

One of the great things about this place was all the different options for sauces, which they gladly bring out bottles of as many as you want so you can try them all on the side!

I went to Broadway Burger Bar & Grill with my husband, his brother and his brother's girlfriend on a Saturday evening before seeing Zumanity. I am going to need to revisit Broadway Burger Bar & Grill sober so that I can write an update... I was pretty Jagered up by the time we arrived, and can't even comment on the burger I had (I will spare you all the details, haha!). I wasn't too drunk to notice a few things though! 
 
Likes: 
Prices weren't bad, considering it was a casino on the Strip. 
There was no wait to be seated at 8 pm on a Saturday night. 
Options for turkey and veggie burgers, variety is always a plus. 

Dislikes: 
I had to ask for water multiple times before I got it. My husband also asked for waters for the table. I was the only one that got a water, after asking again...  And I REALLY needed some water!!!
When my husband asked for his burger to be medium well he was told his options were medium or well, nothing else. 
Most of the beers that our table requested were not available. Having a decent selection of good beers means nothing if the ones people order are not actually available. 

The garlic and herb fries smelled fantastic but I found the flavor to be a little weak. Maybe it was the booze messing with my tastebuds though?? They don't skimp on the amount of fries, consider splitting an order if you aren't a heavy eater. My brother in law RAVED about his burger, he even said it was the best he ever ate. That may have been the whiskey talking though...  My husband devoured his burger as well, and commented that he could really tell the meat was good quality. 

Since the guys were so happy with their meals, I would definitely be down to go back sometime... When I am a little less lubrucated of course!

Not bad for burgers and fries, and of course a drink or two. Garlic fries were pretty ok. Service was great. Only came here because we had to use our dining credit and was short on time and not looking to eat too much. My left over burger was even good at 4 am! =)

We were her for lunch on 2/12/14. The burgers were really good and we had great service from Paul and Baily. Also met a couple from Canada while we were sitting there and just so happens the Canada-US Olympic hockey game was on the teli which made for our conversation. My family are locals and I am here every 6-8 months definitely will be back for the burgers again.
I just had the best burger in town. The English Pub burger was delicious. It comes with fried egg, grilled tomatoes and white cheddar cheese. The chilli cheese fries were awesome too.

I went here last night with my family after a day at the pool. They weren't busy and we were sat right away. Interestingly enough, my favorite part of the meal had nothing to do with the burgers.

 The items  that won my heart were definitely the wings and the root beer floats. The wings were probably some of the best I've ever had. They were crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. The root beer floats were made with custard and I think that that may have been why they were so freaking amazing!! The burgers were huge and cooked well, I'm just not sure they were anything to write home about.

The prices were pretty decent with the burgers coming in around 14$ and sides around 5$. If you want a decent place to eat that won't break the bank, this place should be on your list if you're at the New York New York.

Exactly what you want in a burger place.   Our waitress was very personable and attentive.  We didn't wait for drinks and food came out quick.  The fried pickles were delicious,  the dipping sauce was good.   3 burgers and a salad,  no complaints.  Burgers were cooked as ordered.
Came in for a bite before Zumanity starts and the food was really good. I had the bacon and cheese burger and my hubby the chicken Caesar salad. Couldn't complain about anything.

Very dissapointing. Only thing that lightened up our day was our server Amy.

The place is not really cool to hang out, most people we met we're very much not interested in their work and in us. Amy was a pleasant surprise.

Both burgers were not special. And the ordered mayonaise wasn't served with the food but came out later. Most disappointing was my portabello burger with panko (?). It was so drained with fat that I couldn't lift my burger because the bun was soaked. Not oke.

If you have options: don't go here.

They have a really good chicken sandwich.   We stopped at New York New York casino for a quick bit to eat. Our friends suggested Broadway Burger and we weren't disappointed.  The sandwich was extremely tasty.  The staff was efficient and friendly.  I would recommend this place for a quick bit to eat.

Burgers were really good though almost too large.  Fries were typical if not a little greasy.

However, what impressed me about this place was the service.  Our waitress repeatedly filled our drinks without our having to ask.  She even gave us a cup "to go" on our way out.  When my companion dropped a fork, a passing staff member had one in her hand in under 5 seconds.  She didn't even have a chance to ask.

Been here twice and liked it both times. Waitress was attentive. The onion rings & fries were fresh and the burgers were good. The setup is visually interesting, because you're in the part of the casino that looks like scaled-down city streets. It's slightly diner-esque but that theme is not too heavy-handed. They use cloth napkins, which is nice. They use real chili on the chili fries, but not real cheese (but maybe that's a regional thing?) The menu is one page: types of burger patties (they also have salmon, turkey, and portobello burgers), types of toppings, and types of fries. Desserts and cocktails are available, but they only have about 4 options for each (Long Island Iced Tea is on the menu, of course). It's not a problem, because there are dessert places right next to it. This place is really about the burgers.
It was $50 for 2 people, without cocktails or dessert, but hey (shrug) you're in a tourist hotspot, so you're going to pay more.

Great find! My coworker and I were in town on business and stumbled across Broadway Burger Bar. I don't eat red meat and my coworker is gluten free -- sometimes we can be tough to please. But we were pleasantly surprised to find turkey burgers and gluten free options. Vegetarian and Pescatarian friendly too! Contrary to other reviews, the turkey burger was moist and flavorful -- there's also a ton of sauces and spicy options! The service was incredible (Lashawnda was awesome)! And you can't beat the prices (avg $10 for burgers.) I would definitely recommend.

LOWERED EXPECTATIONS......
Went in here after wandering around the restaurants and thought it looked reasonably priced and tasty. My friend and I ordered food - hers came up in about 8 minutes, mine took exactly 22 minutes. Ridiculous. Then, after receiving my "patty melt" which I paid $7 for, I was saddened to find that it was less flavorful than the sourdough burger I could have gotten for half the price at Jack in the Box.
SAD place, highly disorganized, LONG waits, and mediocre (at best) food. If you're drunk, you may rate this one higher. Otherwise, keep Yelping. You can do better.
Best burger I have ever had. The "cowboy" burger has an amazing blend of bacon and special sauce. Fries were perfectly seasoned and cooked. Service was excellent.

Loved our experience here!!  The service was great!  Our Server was gracious and attentive!  We ordered Martinis that didn't come out just right.  The Bartender came over and offered to re-make them.  The second time around was perfection.  The Manager even came over to check on us.  Their food was delicious and the portions were generous!  We will be back.

There were 7 of us and we stopped by this past Sunday.  We were seated within 5 minutes, the SERVICE WAS PERFECT, and the food was amazing.  We all had different entrees and there were no complaints. Refills happened without having to ask, the food was amazing , and the prices were reasonable for the area.  Loved it.

After watching the 10:00pm show of Zumanity, Minh D and i were in total need of a snack before meeting up with Lucy Y, David G and my friend Ashley for some drinks. Since this was my first time inside of New York-New York hotel i had no clue what was here. Decided on going here since it was protein and they didnt have a wait time. Checked in with the hostess and she seated us right away. The burger bar was on the large side with lots of tables and booths to sit at. Our waitress was sweet and gave us more then enough time to look over their menu. After tossing back and forth ideas on what we wanted, we decided on splitting a Bacon and Cheese Turkey burger (Turkey breast, ground and seasoned with fresh carrots, onions, parsley and spices. Crisp applewood-smoked bacon
and American cheese) 
The burger was kind of on the smaller side but enough to split between two people and fill their tummys up for awhile. I was impressed with the taste of the Turkey burger itself (i know i always repeat that i hate a dry tasting burger especially a Turkey burger) but this was a wow factor the spices and onions made the taste really pop! Sad to say but the bacon was overcooked and small. 
Overlooking the small stuff the burger was pretty tasty and made me happy and looking forward to a night of random fun!!!!

Had the sweet potato fries and they were great. Burger was average. On the dry side probably because our only options were medium and well done. Got the southwestern with jalapeño bacon, but it didn't have bacon. Too hungry to send it back. I like a burger that's juicy and messy and this was none of that. And it was not just me but the most of our party of 9. 


You want a juicy burger this is not the place.

Pretty good burgers and fries here. If I would have known the amount of fries they served with each meal, I probably would have made the suggestion of just ordering one serving and sharing it amongst my cohorts.

The cute waitress did an excellent job with service. No complaints.
Yeah this place with bomb I will definitely come back. Space was cozy I had the turkey with Bree and it was delicious. I will definitely come back next time I'm around Las Vegas yeah

Had the most amazing burger ever. My southwestern burger had jalapeño bacon, guacamole, crumbled cheese and tortilla chips. My wife had a burger topped with cheese steak and was just as good. We also had their garlic fries which were equally good. If you are ever in LV, you need to head to NY NY and eat at Broadway Burger.
Overall 3.5 stars.  The staff is friendly and accommodating. Service is quick and efficient.  The burger was good but not mind blowing.  The fries were good.  I would definitely eat here again.

This was my first place to Eat at when I came to Las Vegas. As soon as we walked in New York New York, we Immediately wanted to find a Place to Eat, so after almost 10 Minutes of walking around we found this place we were sat immediately. 

you get to choose from 24 different Burgers, My dad got the Smokehouse Burger (Shaved Brisket, Chipotle BBQ Sauce and a Grilled Pineapple Cole Slaw), Heat from the BBQ Sauce and Acidity from the Slaw. I got the Cuban Burger (Roasted Pork, Shaved Ham, Pickles, Swiss Cheese and Mustard) I forgot to tell her to hold the Pickles so I took them off myself (No Harm to the Burger) plus I told them to put Brie Cheese on my Burger (Nutty, Gooey, Creamy) and told them to take off the Swiss (A Very Big Burger with a Ton of Meat (the thing was bigger than my Mouth and it was a real Gut Filler). 
We also split a basket of Jalapeno Garlic Fries (Hand Cut Fries, Minced Garlic and a ton of Jalapeno Slices) with every bite I got hit with a good amount of Heat (in a Good Way). Such an awesome first stop on my Trip to Vegas. Hope to get another Burger Next Time !!!

We stumbled there craving a good burger, that is what we got!!

The waite staff was good and tolerated our boisterous behavior. The food came in a resonable time and everything was cooked to our liking. The garlic fries were incredibly good (althought I did need a mint later) just the right amount of garlic. 

Two in our party had the turkey burger and said it was moist, which is not always the case in other places. I had the range and hormone free beef. It was full of flavor.

I'd go again and recommend others

This place was hopping when we went! The burgers were great, and the fries as well.  The prices were decent and I really enjoyed my salmon/rock shrimp burger with remoulade sauce.

Great choice for people who like burgers = )

After scoping out the variety of restaurants available inside NY NY, we settled on this place and it was a good choice for a quick and not too expensive meal.  I had a chicken and brie burger and it was yummy!  Lots of choices here, from the meat (beef, chicken, salmon, or veggie) to toppings and sauces to imported cheeses.  They had expensive but good beers on tap as well.

Tried this place for the first time just walking through New York New York and thought it would be good. Staff was friendly enough, and the restaurant was fairly clean. Made my own burger and ordered sweet potato fries and the burger was ok, bread was stale though, and the fries seemed a little cold. Overall was an ok experience but I probably wouldn't come back again when shake shack is right around the corner.

We had been to this restaurant 3 years ago (the last time in Vegas)  & my partner said it was a must to return again. He loved his last burger so much.

This time around we had the Bacon & Cheeseburger and the Asian style salmon burger. My partner said he enjoyed his Burger, but I noticed he didn't rave on about it like last time. I quite enjoyed the salmon burger. It was nice to see and try something other than beef burgers on a menu. They also had chicken, turkey & vegetarian mushroom burgers available.

We were quick to be seated. It didn't appear to be an overly busy night but about half full.

My only complaint would be that we felt rushed by the waitress. We hadn't even finished our meals & she was trying to take our plates away & plonked the cheque down. I noticed she did it to another customer who was eating alone. Too bad if you wanted to order anything else. She must have been at the end of her shift & in a rush to settle her tips & get out.
There is still a place in Vegas, at a casino that doesn't kill you on price. Decent food and you don;t have to go on run at the Craps table to afford it.
The worst service ever. Waited 45 mins for a damn burger and the manager did nothing about. Never eat here they suck.

We wanted just anything to eat after a long weekend and come here because it was close by. I wanted something a little healthier so I got a turkey burger. We ordered it at the bar and got it to-go and it took forever to get our burgers! I brought it back to our room and it was okay. It was cooked pretty well and had enough seasoning, but it definitely wasn't anything spectacular. It did hit the spot for a quick (kind of) cheap dinner. It doesn't come with fries though :/

Overall, it was okay.

We went for lunch on Sunday when we arrived in Vegas and found this place.  The staff was very nice and fast.  We were seated right away and our server David was great.  He was very friendly and made suggestions for the menu since it was our first time eating here.  His suggestions were right on and we enjoyed the meal.  He was also very helpful with giving us tips for entertaining the kids.  The food was a bit pricey for the serving size but that's not a big deal.  Overall it was a good experience and I'd definitely go back.

Food was amazing and waitress was friendly and prompt with service. Burger was cooked medium and perfect,  regular fries were really good and garlic fries were delicious with actual garlic chunks inside.
Bland. No seasoning on meat. Medium burger was cooked too well done. Prices are decent. $10 for a burger. Burgers don't come with fries, you have to  add it on.

Great great great make your own burger place. Need I say more. It's a great place to stop & have lunch while in Vegas. If you have a small appetite share a burger with someone & order an order of fries with salad to share.
Had the b3 g burger. It was awesome. Super huge and filling. Don't order fries unless your starving. Burger filled me up

Je ressors a peine du restaurant et un avis s'impose ! Beaucoup de resto propose des burgers sur le strip, mais ce resto vaut vraiment le coup de s'y arrêter et déguster leurs burgers ! J'ai testé l'italian et il est vraiment très bon ! Le service est top et le cadre est en coordination avec le thème du resto. Je conseille bien évidemment :) A bientôt je l'espère lors d'un prochain séjour à Vegas.

They have amazing huge burgers for around $10-12. The quality of the meat is outstanding. Wait staff was also super friendly and attentive.

The cowboy- topping of fried onions, pepperjack cheese and thick hickory bacon. 
English pub- simple with a fried egg.
Chili cheese fries- amazing hand cut potatoes, not too oiley with the gooey cheese and chili. Their chili is also made from great beef, none of that cheap stuff.

At this place you can get a decent burger and really greasy fries.  I mean really greasy.  Like bring a roll of paper towels with you to wipe up the grease.

Girlfriend was resting and not hungry during our stay at NY NY, so I came down here for a quick bite.  Sat at the bar and ordered food there.  Bartender service was fine.  She was pleasant and quick and attentive.  And the food was good.  I got a standard BBQ burger - I forget what they call it, but it has bacon and BBQ sauce.  Burger was thick and juicy and cooked right.  It wasn't anything special, but it wasn't anything bad either.  Got an order of their regular fries - they also have garlic fries and, I think, sweet potato fries.  Fries were good, but like I said, you are also ordering a vat of the oil they are cooked in.

There's nothing really wrong with this place, but Gordon Ramsay's burger place is a half mile or so away at Planet Hollywood, and from what I understand, is amazing (granted, this is Vegas, and it takes 30 minutes just to get out of your hotel).  If you don't want to leave the hotel, then by all means, you can get a reasonable burger here.  But, there are better burgers nearby.

Broadway Burger was one the high spots of the places we ate at in Vegas.  The famed buffets we tried were total busts so we decided to try the various eateries in New York-New York.  Of the three we tried, Broadway Burger was the best compared to other burger places.  The choices are many and unique, the flavor of the meat is super, the service is great, and so are the prices compared to others we experienced in Vegas.

Yep a pleasant surprise in the NY, NY casino.  Walk around and find this place off the casino floor.  The burgers are good...the beer flows nicely and you might feel like you are eating on the streets of NY if it wasn't for the dark gloomy lights they use.  But def a good spot for good burgers.

Late night service, veggie burger served in a pita with yogurt sauce...how can you go wrong? Not only was the food DELICIOUS, the waitress anticipated what the BF and I needed before we had to ask and apologized for the wait several times even though I didn't  notice we were waiting. Love it!

Jackie our waitress was super helpful and recommended the best burger combo that fit our tastes believe me they have a bunch of great choices. Our burger had bacon,avocado mushrooms and they have French's  gourmet barbecue sauce. I chose well down and upgraded to garlic fries. I'm a burger connoisseur
And this is a top notch burger joint and not bad on the price  scale it won't break the bank. 
Thumbs up Jackie thanks for your awesome service.

The fries are definitely the biggest wow factor at this place. Amazing, hand cut, thick, crispy fries are served in a baby fryer basket and one order seemed enough for 2 people to share with our burgers. 

I had the chicken BLTA and the bf had one of their burgers. Both were delicious. Like many reviews say, they are on the small side... but I'd rather have portion control versus an overly stuffed tummy or a to-go box. 

I guess you could say our meal was a bit expensive ($33 + tip for 2 burgers, 2 iced teas & one fry), but HELLO......it's in the middle of the NY NY casino. People seem to forget they are also paying for the convenience as well as the atmosphere. 

Recommended!!

Grass fed beef for a super great deal. 
Great chicken as well. Absolutely wonderful food. This was my first time at New York New York and this place is definitely the go-to here. Fast and friendly service. Pretty loud, but that's expected from a casino with a roller coaster. I recommend to everyone who likes meat!

We were in vegas and wanted to go to shake shack on a saturday night and holy hell was it crowded. Big long line out the door. Not wanting to put up with that we went to new york new york and found a burger place there. I'm so glad we did because there was no wait, and the food was exceptional and affordable. The burgers were delicious and the fries are natural cut and taste great and you get a whole basket of them with a combo. Or you can choose a plate of chili cheese fries with your combo for no extra charge. Who does that? So nice. I would definitely go there again.

Surprisingly decent burger, and very good service! And fair prices at that. 

Our group of 6 were sat immediately on a Saturday evening...albeit a very quiet Saturday by Vegas standards. Looking over the beer menu, we were very impressed with the selection and price - tasty beers for decent (Strip-wise) prices. 

I had a Greek burger with onion rings. The burger itself came in a pita with tzatziki, and I ordered it with feta cheese (which I don't believe is on the menu, but they have it). It was very, very good. The onion rings were okay...not the most flavorful, but fine.

Everyone else enjoyed their burgers, but I was so in to mine that I don't remember what they had. 

One negative is that they only give you burgers done, I believe, medium or well. Clearly assembly line burgers, but so be it. Medium is usually too done for me, but when there is no choice, there's no choice.
Service was slow and the waiter gave us an attitude when we cancelled our order to make it to our show. Never coming here again.
By far the best burger place I have ever been to. The salmon burger mushroom Swiss style is amazing!!!! Can't wait to come back next year!

This time when in Vegas, I sat at the bar and Ben was my waiter/bartender.  Ben was great, we had some good conversations.
I tried the Salmon Burger and it was killer.  And the fries were excellent.
Price was good, service was great, nice people everywhere.  What more could you ask for?
Will visit again when in town.

Was ist denn jetzt los?
Wo man mir vor drei Jahren noch einen schmackhaften Burger mit allem Zipp und Zapp kredenzte, kam jetzt ein lieblos dahin geknallter Burger mit fadem Rindfleisch-Patty und Scheibe Käse ohne jegliche Soße daher. Nicht einmal Ketchup war darauf, das las sich in der Menükarte ganz anders.
Gut, ich hatte keine Pommer dazu bestellt, denn aus Erfahrung und nach vier Wochen im Amiland weiß man, dass es eh zwecklos ist und es allenfalls schafft, zwei Pommer anzuknabbern, aber dass es so gar keine Deko und nicht einmal das obligatorische saure Gürkchen gab? Das fand ich für den Preis von 14 Dollar frech. Der Teller war so kahl, dass mich das Weiß fast blendete.
Tja, da werden wir wohl nicht noch einmal hingehen... irgendwie komisch. Wo es Burgerläden wie Slot Machines im Casino gibt, sollte man mehr Wert auf gutes Essen legen. Der Service konnte es auch keiner nicht mehr herausreißen, dass der Koch irgendwie wohl keine Lust mehr hatte.

We hope you go there when Bailey is the bartender!   
She us very pleasant and knowledgeable about her beer.  
The happy hour is wonderful! .   Highly recommend the pickle fries and the hoisin chicken wraps.
As of this posting , these and all beers were $5 between 2 and 5 pm.
Food and service here was pretty good! Would recommend the BBQ Bacon Burger with a cold draft of your choice!

The burgers here were really good.  Our server was attentive and efficient.  The fries come in their own little baskets, which was a cute touch.  The only thing we would do differently would be that we would only order one burger & fries and split it.  The burgers were huge and the french fry portions were too.  They use very good quality beef for their burgers, and it shows with the very first yummy bite.
BOOOOO! That is the overall for this place. The food was no good, over done (I asked for medium), service was slow, and I could have eaten at a lot of other good places on the strip for the price.

Meh. Eh. Blah. 

Before making the long drive back to LA, the 'crew' (i lack a better term) - and I were cranky, hungry and hung over and couldn't agree on a kind of food to consume. When in doubt, grab a burger. So stumbling around New York, New York - we ran into this place. 

It was pretty empty so we figured we could get some food relatively quick and hit the road. Too bad that wasn't the case. 

The service was ridiculous. It wasn't busy at all and there were plenty of staff around to get to us, but mannnnnnn slow is not descriptive enough. I guess everyone else was hungover too. 

Anyway, I was digging the idea of grass fed beef and all that hipster burger-ness that I adore. Too bad it didn't deliver. 
My burger was on the dry side (so much for med rare), the bun was a bit day old feeling and the flavors were gamey and over seasoned. Damn it. I hate when I waste calories on bad food. 

Also, one of the burger options says 'avocado' whereas another option is 'guacamole' so I assumed that there were two options. Nope - no avocado. Stooopid. 
But the guac was fresh - I have to give it to them on that. 
(However, that begs the question of whether it was homemade...which means I could have had avocado plain, right? - anyway.)

ON THE POSITIVE: The bacon was thick and tasty and the fries were very tasty and real. Made from actual taters. Appreciation for that.

Can't remember when I have ever had to ask "how much longer will it be"? For our food! This place was s-l-o-w--- waitress served sodas and also served us another before food came... My sweeties order was wrong..wrong burger... My order was for a medium cooked burger and it was cooked well done! I could not believe it! The table of 6 people next to us were not happy for the long wait for their food either and the waitress brought them their French fries first! I won't be back...ever!!!  A $12.00 burger???really??? The one star is for the waitress!

My trip to the Broadway Burger only scraped it's way by because I was starving my butt off! Otherwise, this burger joint was a real disappointment to eat at :/

I ordered a burger that had BBQ sauce on it, which made it juicy..but unfortunately..the meat was way dry! Also, I got the loaded fries which were just so-so. They sprinkle the wrong cheese on it, and even though there are jalapeños, it wasn't at all spicy! Everything about the entire meal was completely average. 

The service was really great, on the bright side!! Our waiter was funny and personable, and he didn't mind that I was little late for my reservation. (lol) 

Overall, I would say pass on this restaurant; unless you're starving and everyone else has a long, long line!!!

ABSOLUTE GARBAGE!!!!! I got the Philly Burger and it was SO WET the buns were SOAKED! Frozen burger cooked like S***!!!! I could've made a better burger with my body hanging from the ceiling while repeating the preamble while a midget kicks me in the nuts! DO NOT GO HERE!!!! GO TO GREENBERGS, 10000000000X BETTER THAN THIS JOKE

Ok I have said this before, I am not much of a burger fan. My grandchildren wanted burgers so we came here. I must say over anything our waiter was exceptionally good. The booths were comfy and the food ended up being great. I had a turkey burger which was really good.  I took a bite of the partners burger and it was exceptional yummy for being beef. Oh yes and the garlic fries were just perfect. I would definitely recommend this place and come back here again ...

The fries was so greasy and burnt l. They look so dark seem like it was deep fried on over used oil. 
Over priced burger PLZ include the fries for free. Our waitress was nice. He recommend us on cheese steaks burger trying to sell us probably nasty steaks. The manager should stop telling their waitress to recommend dishes because we don't even eat BEEF! It was awkward listening to him describing how juicy and yummy the cheese steaks we were just disgusted lol. Yeah save it and save our time. The chicken burger was very dried. Like it has been sitting there in microwave for long time. Turkey burger was delicious and it was cheaper than the chicken burger i wonder why. They were so slow on our food. We waited more than 30mins.

We arranged for a group of 40 of us cyclists to have lunch here. As a former server let me say 40 people is a lot to handle, even if your business does it often. The staff were all very helpful and polite and the burgers were all very unique and tasty. I had the Philly cheesesteak burger with garlic and jalapeño fries. Wow! Very very good burger and I have pretty decent standards for those. The only thing that would keep me from giving 5 stars here is that they had no draft beer as the line for the kegs were blown. This is forgivable usually but the only thing they had for bottles were your typical domestic lagers which aren't my favorite. Still well done for serving 40 people.

We went very late after attending the George Strait concert next door at the T-Mobile Arena.
We were seated sometime after midnight, and the place was still very busy on a Friday night.
We waited a good amount of time to be helped, which was having me sit there thinking if we should go try somewhere else.

I was happy that we waited, because the food here was worth the wait. It is pricey for what you get,as well. The burger that I had was sold by itself, but I was able to add fries and a soda for something like $5 extra. Overall, the price was over $40 for two burgers,two fries and two sodas plus tip.

Our waitress was very nice and professional as well.

Not very good. My friends and I were hungry, and we mistakenly chose the first place we could find. All five of us felt like our burgers were dry, when we ordered medium, and that the buns tasted borderline stale. We all left unsatisfied.

Deeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeelicious!

Broadway Burger Bar & Grill is where I devoured one of the best tasting burgers in my life!

Do I remember what it was? Noooooooo... but it had bacon on it, and cheese.  Their garlic french fries were divine, and they even served a brand of root beer that I had never heard of before for my root beer float.  That just means it's really authentic, really old, or... really cheap.

The friend I was with loved what she ordered as well.  The waitress set us up on a four-top, half booth half stand alone chairs, and we could look out at the casino.  That was cool.  The restaurant wasn't very crowded so I was pretending she set us up there on account of how purdy we looked that day.

I do remember paying something like $40 for everything - everything being two burgers, an order or fries, a beer and the aforementioned root beer float.  Sounds about right for a restaurant, ya?

The noise level is pretty average, where we were sitting by the kitchen anyway.  You sort of get used to the singing of slot machines while inside any casino so someone with a sensitivity to noise might think other than me. However, I do feel that where we were sitting (and you can completely see it if you go in there - it's a four-top half booth/half stand alone chairs, leaning up against the kitchen) was devoid of any distractions at all.  And I was probably hungover.  For a hungover person to think it's quiet, then I'd say you can trust that judgment.

Tasteless burger..on a gluten free bunch and the cheddar cheese had no flavor either..i might as well have been eating a grilled soul off my shoe...French fries the bartender told me they were hand cut and fresh...But of course they came out all wilted and thats not how fries should be if they know what they are doing....ill pass on this joint...

The burgers here blew my mind!!!! The meat is tender, filled with flavor and seasoned to perfection. Each bite was a party in my mouth :-P. I highly recommend the salmon burger and turkey burger. In both, the meat is so tender it melts in your mouth. This place has become a must whenever I go to Vegas!
Very good burgers and draft choices. Service was great at the bar. Made for a great visit during my first trip to Vegas.

Burgers are great. Got the salmon burger with white cheddar and crispy onions. They don't put sauces though unless you specifically ask which I didn't know I was supposed to do. Tasted better when I got ranch on the side... Garlic fries are EXCELLENT!

Had a really tasty burger from here and some great crunchy fries. The wait for the burger was maybe a touch longer than expected - I think it was about 15 minutes. I usually think a burger is a quick thing. I think it was quite busy though in the main restaurant bit. I ate at the bar area.

My fiance and I decided to try this place on our last trip to Vegas and were pleasantly surprised.  The burgers were delicious!  They had a very broad menu and it is really a "create your own" burger type of place.  My fiance and I enjoyed the food so much that we went back the very next night for dinner.  Burger Bar is also very reasonably priced considering that you are in Las Vegas (places like Subway and Panda Express cost $10+).  I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a relaxing place to eat on a budget, or want something to put in your stomach after doing some drinking.  Honestly, it has become one of my go to places while in Las Vegas.
The mozzarella triangles and garlic fries was delicious. The service sucks. Had to flag her down constantly. It's because of her I won't return. She needs better training

Excellent everything. Hands down! 

Even though the strip isn't a favorite of my family's to do anything on. I convinced my mother to come try Burger Bar for lunch after only being here once before. Loved it then and only love it 1,000xs times more now! 
Cherese was our server and she was beyond amazing and helpful! Constantly making sure our drinks were filled and orders were perfect!! 
We ordered a Caesar salad to start along with two build your own burgers! Veggie patty let me tell you. TOO DIE FOR!!!! 

What else made this memorable is being approached by the General Manager Jeff! Just checking on everyone is a quality you don't see much these days! His smile and small talk definitely has us coming back to visit him and his amazing store! 

Thank you so much for the awesome service Cherese and Jeff! You guys definitely made us think differently of visiting the strip. Even if maybe it is only for you guys from now on!

Excellent burger! High end beef, wonderful flavor combo and the server (Dave) was the absolute best. I highly recommend the food and to maximize your experience, request Dave as your server - he totally rocks!!!
Bought a greasy hotdog before entering Zumanity.

Do not leave Las Vegas without stopping here! We didn't even stay in New York New York but we came in before we had to go to the airport. We decided to try this place on a whim after looking at all of the menus in the food court area. The burgers were to die for the hand-cut fries amazing some of the best prices in Vegas for the amount of food that you get and the taste. Put the buffets that we went to here to shame. Also the custard shakes are where it at!

Garlic fries are a must and a place that serves arrogant bastard on tap has to be pretty good.  Wife and I ordered the cowboy and mushroom burger.  Holy cow!  Awesome and good riddance of the old place yeah it was cheaper but you skimped on taste and quality

This place was great. They have kids menu which I thought was great. The kids burgers are small however. It may satisfy kids 7/8 or under. Their prices were pricey but doable. They serve 100 percent free range grass fed burgers. That's rare!  According to the hostess, their buns are made in house or at least withen the hotel. Their frying oil is not trans-fat and didn't taste as if they were frozen. Fries tasted good. The burgers were fantastic. Looked small at first untill you start eating then you start to realize it's a good amount of meat. Went in very hungry and left extremely full. They also had a ton of condiment to choose from. Since they are a healthier restaurant, they should offer simply heinz. Some of us are not a HFCS friendly:-)

The reason for the four star was their service. The food came out quickly. No issue there. When we first came to ask the hostess about the food quality she was very informative and even double checked on her anwser to be sure. We went in as a table of 12, 4 adults and 8 kids. The hostess said they would be able to sit us. I grabbed the whole crew and they had planned to seat us at two different tables. There were hardly anyone at the restaurant so it was easy to connect the tables. When they saw that we were not satisfied, they managed to put us on the high top tables which was fine. We ordered and they gave us an extra kid's burger for a 3 year old girl who the mom did not order a burger for. We notified them and they took the burger away but after the 3 year old saw the burger she wanted it. The mom was originally going to give her a lil piece of hers. So we ask that we take the burger back since she's complaining about it. It was their error for causing the girl to complain. I expected the burger to be comped. Lastly, because the gratuity was included the server was lacking on giving us her best service. We can tell the difference when gratuity is included. If she would have given a friendlier service I would have tipped on top of the gratuity. 

When back in Vegas, I will most likely stop here again. Hopefully the service will be better!

Like most of the restaurants in NYNY, this was top notch. A bit pricey for burgers but well worth it. 

You have the choice of the type of meat and they cook it perfectly. Grab a shake from Ben & Jerry to go with it. The fries and onion rings were so good! The staff was friendly and attentive.

Decided to find a burger in Vegas before we said our final goodbyes to this town.  The ambience in here was everything you need from a good burger joint.  We ordered the chili fries which were delicious and fresh cut; simply delicious and savory.  The pub burger with a fried egg and French fries inside  this amazing and perfectly cooked burger was the perfect farewell meal.  Highly recommend this place.  Staff was courteous  and very accommodating. I will  definitely  visit again when I  return to  Vegas.

This place has bad reviews but I'm not really sure why?

Yes, you'll pay a dollar or 2 more for a burger here then you would in main street, Any Town, USA but you are at New York, NY hotel on the Vegas Strip.  Nothing is cheap here, not even the hot dog from the other stand.  

I got a smoked chicken salad on arugula, goat cheese, walnuts and a yummy vinaigrette dressy.  Warning, the goat cheese came fried in a ball, but it was delicious!  The salad is large and a great portion of chicken,

BF got the a turkey burger with some toppings that seemed solid enough to me.

The server was really nice, we explained we had less than 30 minutes until our Cirque show started.  She explained all burgers are made to order and will take 20 minutes.  Our food came out in 20 minutes, she had our checks and everything ready.

Also, since the bar was limited to beer and wine, we were allowed to bring drinks from other bars inside which I know a lot of places frown upon.

Why is this literally the BEST BURGER IVE EVER HAD?!? Short story, long: 
New Year's Day 2017: Hungover grumpass Rach wasn't hungry so I snagged a bite (duh) of the burger my boyfriend ordered at some random spot at NYNY Hotel after (attempting to) ride the roller coaster on our last day of Vegas trip. Surprise.....: BEST motherflarping bite-turned-oops-I-ate-your-whole-buger IN. THE. WORLD. 
Today, a full 6 months of dreaming about this burger later, dreams have turned to reality. I got my rabid little raccoon hands on that miracle burger again today and by the grace of the BurgerGods, it still reigns supreme as the Emporer of Burgers. The #Empurger.

Bonus points: BOTH visits we got lucky enough to have made friend with and been provided with the BEST service from the bartender (and our server) ASHLEY. Girl, you are amazing, it's your fantastic service and that dang burger that will keep us coming back and recommending Burger Bar Las Vegas to our friends forever!
Great choice of burgers.  I created my own with bacon, mushrooms and provolone.  It was delicious.  Fries were excellent as was the service.
Great burgers. Lots of unique choices. This is a great place to go if you want a change from the norm. Plus, it's in NY NY on the strip!

Have it your way - starting with the burger itself: Beef, Chicken, Salmon, Turkey, or Veggie. I started with the desire of a salmon burger and added bacon and cheese. The result was a pretty close to perfect combination where the salmon was surprising juicy for being ground.

Service was great - both quick and attentive. I would definitely return for a quick casual meal in the future.

After a couple days of drinking a good ole fashion giant burger is just something I was craving and let me tell you Broadway Burger hit the spot. I had the Western Cowboy Burger with bacon BBQ and fried onions on top. one day and the Philly Cheese Steak Burger which is basically a Philly cheesesteak on a burger, works out great. Both were amazing and large and hit the spot. 

Also for a side I would recommend the Jalapeño Garlic Fries, were spicy and tasty. The Garlic and Herb fries looked great as well.

As for beer cause well of course you are in Vegas they have a large craft beer section and many tasty beers to go with that.

After first arriving in Las Vegas, this is the first place my friends and I ate for lunch at and we were certainly not disappointed. As far as burgers go, I would say, this is as good as your going to get. The portion size per burger is huge, the amount of choices you can get on it are endless, and the taste and quality is perfect. Went here twice (once at the beginning of my trip and once at the end) and both times we enjoyed the place very much. I've had many standard hamburgers, but Broadway Burger in NYNY is far beyond that. I almost wish I stayed longer to try all the burger options.


PROS
*Price - For the price it was certainly worth it. With tip, I think I paid around $16 for a really good burger. That may sound expensive, but for Las Vegas I think that is pretty reasonable after everything is said and done.

*Quality & Taste - A lot of fancy restaurants overcharge for a standard hamburger, but this place really brings flavor and juice to its burgers. Not to even mention there are a ton of options to put on your burger and make it how you really want. I got the Cowboy burger and added a fried egg, to give it a ton of extra flavor.

*Portion Size - Burger is huge. You will be full after eating it.

*Atmosphere - It's in NYNY, so when you're eating there, you feel like your actually in a city. It's pretty cool have they have a whole section for restaurants in the area, so when you walk around you'll see a NY Pizza place and so on.

CONS
*Caesar Salad and Fries - Really the only negative I saw with this place was the Caesar salad and the fries. The Caesar salad was very dry and not very flavorful. They didn't really have caesar dressing, but just some parmesan cheese. Also, I wasn't the biggest fan of the fries, but to be honest, I've had much worse too.

Good burgers excellent onion rings and fries service seem less than par. Waitress was in a group talking and I had to go over and ask for a refill on my tea and my burger bun was missing half of it and waitress never came over to see how our meal was so I couldn't tell them about my bun that actually should not have been served. All in all the food is good.

We were starving after being on our feet most of the day.  Popped in here for a bite before crashing.  Seated very quickly and ordered quickly as well.  

Ordered the Greek burger, cooked medium.  Cooked perfect, still juicy.  The Tzatziki sauce was good, spicy.  Overall burger was good, to the point the juice is dripping down your arm good.  I would recommend it.  Fries were average, not crunchy at all.  
After eating it did take a bit to get our check but I will say the waitress was hustling gn with all the tables she had to cover.

The burgers, onion rings, and fries here are absolutely delicious and if you don't mind waiting a while to get them, you will be satisfied. Be prepared to spend a pretty penny as well, as a meal for 2 can quickly turn into $40+
Nice looking place. Prices are average for a nice casino on the strip. Unfortunately the food was very bland. Need some seasoning on the burgers. The chili same issue not much flavor.

Like almost every review on here my experience was average. Good service. Attentive very nice server. Unfortunately the food was limited in selection, dry, bland, and forgettable. So much so in fact that i had to set a reminder to write this review. Good concept, poor execution

Great food! Nice size portions and Sandra my waitress was soooo helpful. They were closing in a few mins and the other waitresses didnt want to sit us but Sandra did!! Had the chili cheese fries, and a salad with a burger. Had to share everything of course, only because the portions are so big!
Sometimes ya jus want a good hamburger...HOW YOU WANT IT. This is the place for that. HIGHLY RECOMMEND...if youre serious about your burger...and your bison...YOU HAVE A PLACE TO GO!!!

This review will be sweet and simple...

My baby girl and I stopped here for a late lite bite during a fun night out. We ordered two onion ring appetizers and they were delicious! This review is solely based on service and the onion rings, both were Fantastic! 

Reasonable prices and the onion rings were yummy!

After walking by Broadway Burger Bar & Grill on our first day in Vegas, I knew I had to come back and try it out. It's a really cute little restaurant in the NY, NY hotel and I had high hopes for it being great! However, as much as I wanted to like it, it was honestly a bit disappointing. The service was a little too careless and slow (we waited for a loooong time for water refills and the food itself), and the food a little too tasteless, and the prices too high... So overall, though the location and decor was cute, everything else was kind of blech.

When staying on the Las Vegas strip I am just overwhelmed with Burger joints. Wait, when it comes to eating, a fat juicy burger does not come to mind. We had a staycation in Vegas and needed to feed our kids since it took us forever to check out. So we had brunch at Broadway Burger Bar because the little people needed French fries and hamburgers. 

When you walk in, per my husband, it's like having lunch in New York. It's loud in the casino making the place loud, a little gloomy (it was tucked away in a dark alley near Zumanity), and the AC blew nice. The hostess and server were welcoming and it was very clean. 

Dear husband had the Mushroom Swiss. It liked it. The meat was hearty and it was a thick piece! I settled with the Cowboy which included: onion strings, pepper jack cheese and BBQ sauce, it was really good. They offer kids meals: mac n cheese, hamburger, or chicken tender. We went for the chicken tenders and burger for the kids. They finished all their food! The fries are a medium cut, they give you a lot and I recommend the garlic fries. 

I'm not a burger fan and I'm glad we all enjoyed our brunch here at Broadway Burger Bar.

One of the best burgers that I have ever had and I'm not even too crazy about burgers! They use all natural grass fed cattle for the meat. The meat is so tender and juicy! The staff was extremely friendly and attentive. I will be coming back here during my next visit!
Excellent house  salad with croutons that are homemade .  amazing onion rings we will be back the next time we're in Vegas. Sheba was doing great

Tasty burgers.  We ordered the Italian and the Philly burger medium.  The patties were cooked just as ordered and the overall taste was good.  We also had the garlic and chili cheese fries with a Caesar salad.  I liked the garlic fries more than the chili cheese.  We wanted to keep our stomachs ready for the buffet, so we ordered 2 burgers to share among the 4 of us.  And to be honest, it was more than enough to get us all full.  It came out to be a $50+ lunch for the food and drinks, but hey, that's Vegas for you.

We were at the New York New York for the Manhattan Express roller coaster... and after walking around so much, we were hungry. 

We shared a hot dog and some fries. Both were edible/decent.. nothing special here.

I've had some great tasting burgers lately. So when I eat a burger nowadays, I expect that trend to continue and be impressed. Unfortunately not everyone makes an A+ burger. One can only dream of having the burger streak that I've been on right?

This location is convenient, it's the first thing you spot right after walking out of Zumanity. Located in the the Village Shops at NY-NY. Watching people indulge in their burgers makes it look good and tempting, especially when you're hungry. We weren't too hungry though, so Sarah A. and I split a:

Bacon & Cheese Turkey Burger - The patty was flavorful but overall the burger was too dry. I like my burger dripping wet and sloppy! Dry patty and overcooked bacon was too tough. It wasn't exactly the biggest burger either.

Drunk people overlook quality and gobble down everything. Too bad we weren't drunk enough.

holy crap. order the veggie burger. do it. with sweet potato fries. their veggie burger used to suck, they changed it so it's like a giant breaded mushroom wtf literally it was so amazing. caps lock means i'm yelling this as i am typing. ITS SO GOOD.

I didn't have a great experience here, but I was so hungry i was going to settle for anything.

Two of us ordered a beef burger (medium) and it tasted like cardboard. We were just disappointed it wasn't juicy, or seasoned.

We also ordered a couple of their signature cocktails, which got us tipsy, but it tasted more like the blue agave than actual alcohol. I doubt the drinks were even mixed.

The best part of the meal was probably the chili cheese fries. Oh yeah- all of their fries were pretty good, better than their burgers.

Finally, my problem with this place was that I sat in a really sketchy chair. My lower right thigh got a rash after sitting there for an hour. It couldn't have been from anywhere else since I was standing all day at the T-Mobile center for an event. I noticed the rash once I got up to my room and showered. 

Lesson learned.
Easy eats and always hits the spot. Joe (an immigrant from Baltimore, Go Ravens) took good care of everything and made it memorable. I will stop back every time I am in town.

We decided to stay for a little while longer while in Vegas after the rest of our group left, and pick up some winnings, gamble the rest of our money, return a lost cell phone, and take advantage of the many dining possibilities that wouldn't be available once we got on the road.

After walking quite a bit hungover, and being probably the most sober I have ever been in Vegas, I was getting a TAD cranky, as was my cousin, who was having major clothing issues.  My poor boyfriend was dealing with us, but also really wanted to make it to NY NY because he had fond memories of it and its food court.  When we finally made it into the casino, I refused to eat at the food court because the lack of comfortable seating, and so, we compromised at a cheaper sit down restaurant, and ended up at Broadway Burger Bar and Grill.

They have a decent beer selection, that even though it isn't vast, it is a good selection of lesser known beers at decent prices ($6 pint) for Vegas (they have your boring standard beers if you really want to save the $.50, but then you wouldn't be my friend).  They have lots of different burger options, and you have your choice of beef, chicken, veggie, turkey or salmon.  My cousin and I ended up with the Southwestern and the BF got the Black and Blue with garlic fries to share. 

In my state anything would have tasted good, but jalapeno bacon was just what the doctor ordered.  The Southwestern kicked major butt, with a great blending of flavors, and that delicious jalapeno bacon!  The Black and Blue was also good, but a little boring in comparison (it hurts my heart to call roquefort boring).  The burgers came on a great bun.  At first I thought it seemed a little large for the burger, but it really held its own against the sauces, and had a good taste on its own.  The fries were also really tasty, though I wouldn't have minding a tad more garlic, story of my life.

The service was very nice and attentive, and it was just what I needed to get my stamina up to make it back to our car (or maybe that was the hoppy beer).  The food was good, the prices were right, and how can you not love a restaurant that the fries come in a fryer basket?

Loved this place--we had their bacon, cheddar burgers cooked "medium well" with a side of fries and a couple of beers.  Our server, LaDawna, was great.  The burgers were excellent as were the fries and service.  The price wasn't too bad either.  I don't think we waited more than 10 minutes for our food.  It was a nice break from having to navigate through the tremendous amount of high priced restaurants Las Vegas has to choose from.  Vegas ain't cheap anymore!

Went to new York new york for poker room...since it was like 11pm...we decided to just go and eat somewhere with ok price....
We went to an Irish pub...holy cow...expensive...then we stumble upon Broadway...looks like a small place until we got sitted  it's huge...
The decor of course is new York..like you are in new York city diner...love the decor...sorry no pics coz I was drunk...haha
Meemee had salad and she said it's Uber good...
I had mushroom Swiss burger...with fries...mmmm yummy 
The waiter was so patient with me...since I wasn't myself.
.they didn't carry coke...me sad..but got something equivalent to sprite...so all gud..
I have to applaud the server...I guess he gets alot of drunk customers therefore he understands...
They got all different condiments too...whaaaaat yummy... 
In conclusion...the service great...
The food....great....
The decor....great....

I went here in late March while playing the ponies in the NYNY Casino sports book. I walked up to the bar area, took a seat and was approached fairly quickly by a bartender that offered me a drink. It was about 11:00am, so alcohol wasn't in the question. 

I cannot recall the name of the burger that I had, but it was your run of the mill hamburger with the fried egg in it. I opted out of the cheese and had some sweet potato fries on the side. 

The reason it gets 4 stars is because of the taste, location, value, and service. Unfortunately, the "touristy-ness" takes away a star, and that's not the restaurant's fault. I understand it's part of a big tourist area and how they try really hard to appeal for tourist dollars. The price is very good given the type of food you are ordering and the location of the restaurant.  Finally, the service was good. I remember that the bartender was very friendly, and knew that most of the patrons coming in and out of their restaurant were people who were playing the sports book and/or ponies, like myself.

In essence, this place offers a good quality "high end" burger. I am a fan. See attached picture of my meal.
